Pendant beaucoup d'annÃ©es, les juifs ont fait face Ã la punition horrible pour Ãªtre des juifs pendant les Ã¢ges moyens. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Au 19Ã¨me siÃ¨cle, les vagues de l'anti-sÃ©mitisme ont Ã©cartÃ© Ã travers l'Europe de l'Est, oÃ¹ beaucoup de le juif a vÃ©cu. Beaucoup de juifs ont Ã©migrÃ© aux Etats-Unis et l'Europe. Certains se sont dÃ©placÃ©s en Palestine, l'endroit de la terre antique de l'Israel. Cette idÃ©e de crÃ©er un nouvel Ã©tat juif s'appelle Zionism. L'holocauste de la deuxiÃ¨me guerre mondiale, quand six millions de juifs ont Ã©tÃ© assassinÃ©s, s'est ajoutÃ© Ã l'intensitÃ© du mouvement sioniste. La guerre a Ã©galement laissÃ© beaucoup de rÃ©fugiÃ©s juifs en Europe. Beaucoup prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©s pour Ã©tablir une nouvelle nation plutÃ´t que se dÃ©placent Ã de nouvelles maisons, ou vont de nouveau Ã leur mÃ¨re patrie. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Les Nations Unies ont notÃ© le besoin de patrie juive, et en 1947, elle a recommandÃ© que la Palestine soit transformÃ©e en Ã©tat juif. Le 14 mai 1948, David Ben-Gurion, le premier premier ministre de l'Israel, l'indÃ©pendance de l'Israel avouÃ©. Beaucoup de pays arabes se sont opposÃ©s Ã cette dÃ©cision, et ceci a Ã©tincelÃ© les annÃ©es du conflit Israelo-Arabe qui viendraient. L'Israel puisque s'est dÃ©veloppÃ© en dÃ©mocratie moderne, et est l'un des pays les plus puissants dans le Moyen-Orient.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Israel ist eine kleine Nation im Mittlere Osten, gelegen im SÃ¼dwesten Asien auf dem Rand des Mittelmeermeeres. Der Zustand von Israel wurde in 1948 als Schutz fÃ¼r Juden weltweit hergestellt. Die GrÃ¼nder des modernen Zustandes von Israel suchten, ein neues Land herzustellen dessen Grundregeln, Gewohnheiten und Lebensart jÃ¼disch sein wÃ¼rde. [PARAGRAPH: 2] JÃ¼dische KÃ¶nigreiche blÃ¼hten in der Region in den alten Zeiten, aber vor 1948, hatte es keinen jÃ¼dischen Zustand fÃ¼r 2.000 Jahre gegeben. Die Juden wurden auf der ganzen Erde nach dem Romans hatten gefahren sie heraus in den ersten und zweiten Jahrhunderten V. CHR. zerstreut. Trotz dieser ganzer UnterdrÃ¼ckung vergaÃen die Juden nie das Land von Israel. Die Juden werden nah mit dem Land von Israel wegen aller frommen FÃ¤lle angeschlossen, die in Israel auftraten. Es gab auch sehr wichtige FÃ¤lle in der Geschichte in Israel, wie der ZerstÃ¶rung des BÃ¼gels und des Aufstieges und Fall der jÃ¼dischen KÃ¶nigreiche. Als Juden im mittleren Alter verfolgt wurden, war es die Hoffnung des ZurÃ¼ckbringens nach Israel, das sie lebendig hielt. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Die Exodus aus Ãgypten, Leitung durch Moses heraus, fÃ¼hren die HebrÃ¤er zum alten Land von Israel. Die Philister zwangen die HebrÃ¤er, unter einem einzelnen FÃ¼hrer, Saul zu vereinigen, die die HebrÃ¤er zum Sieg Ã¼ber den Philistern fÃ¼hren. Saul wird normalerweise als der erste hebrÃ¤ische KÃ¶nig angesehen. Saul wurde vom KÃ¶nig David gefolgt. David war ein Held von der Kindheit, als er gemustert dem LÃ¶wetier Goliath getÃ¶tet hatte. David erklÃ¤rte Jerusalem das Kapital und verursachte ein leistungsfÃ¤higes MilitÃ¤r. David holte auch die Arche der Vereinbarung nach Jerusalem, das zwei Steintabletten enthielt, auf denen die 10 Gebote geschrieben wurden. Solomon folgte David. Solomon war ein Vorlagendiplomat, der StraÃen, Festungen und einen kÃ¶niglichen Palast errichtet. Das meiste berÃ¼hmte ist der BÃ¼gel Solomons, bekannt als der BÃ¼gel von Solomon. Der BÃ¼gel von Solomon war die Mitte der jÃ¼dischen Religion in dieser Zeit [PARAGRAPH: 2] Hohe Steuern in Israel fÃ¼hren zu die Abteilung des KÃ¶nigreiches. Der Norden, Israel, getragen die meisten der BevÃ¶lkerung und der Gegend. Der kleine und sÃ¼dliche Teil stand Judah. Israel Ã¼berlebte fÃ¼r zwei Jahrhunderte. Es wurde innerlich zerstÃ¶rt und wurde durch rivalisierende Reiche verfangen. Bei 734 BC, drangen die Assyrians Israel ein. Sie tÃ¶teten viele Israelite und verbannten viel mehr. Judah, hatte weniger GewalttÃ¤tigkeit als Israel. In 586 BC, fiel Jerusalem zu den Babylonians und der BÃ¼gel von Solomon wurde zerstÃ¶rt. Aber das Judeans lehnte ab, Heimaten von Judah dort zu vergessen. Das Judeans kam zusammen in Versammlungen, die der VorlÃ¤ufer fÃ¼r synogogues waren. Dort gehÃ¶rt auf Prophete. Als Cyrus das groÃe von Persien Steuerung der palÃ¤stinensischen LÃ¤nder nahm, lieÃ er das Judeans zu dort zurÃ¼ckgehen landet. FÃ¼r 600 Jahre gab es einen anderen jÃ¼dischen Zustand. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Als das Judeans nach Israel zurÃ¼ckging, war der ProzeÃ des Verursachens eines neuen KÃ¶nigreiches hart. Es gab fromme MÃ¼hen in Israel. Nichtjuden wurden in der Judean Gesellschaft geverachtet. Neue Prophete muÃten unterrichten, daÃ Gott nicht nur fÃ¼r die Juden bedeutet wurde, aber alle Leute. Im vierten Jahrhundert BC, besiegte Alexander das groÃe das Land. Dieses geholt in heidnische Gewohnheiten zum Land. Irgendeine Jugend verlieÃ sogar jÃ¼dische Traditionen. Eine Lehre des neueren Griechen, Antiochus Epiphanes, verfolgte die Juden und ihre Traditionen. Unter Judah Maccabee und seine BrÃ¼der, erweiterte sich ein Aufruhr. In 165 war der jÃ¼dische Zustand noch einmal unabhÃ¤ngig. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Im ersten Jahrhundert BC, eroberte Rom den jÃ¼dischen Zustand. Richtlinie Roms war tyrannisch und ein jÃ¼discher Aufruhr fing in 66 V. CHR. an. Die rÃ¶mischen Legionen eroberten Jerusalem nach einem langen Widerstand in 70 V. CHR. Das Romans zerstÃ¶rte den BÃ¼gel, und alle, die blieb, war die Wand. Diese Wand wurde wie die Klagemauer bekannt und ist der heiligste Platz fÃ¼r Gebet fÃ¼r die Juden heute. In ANZEIGE 73 wurden das Romans erobertes Masada und der jÃ¼dische Zustand zerstÃ¶rt. Die jÃ¼dischen Leute waren im Exil. FÃ¼r viele Jahre stellten die Juden schreckliche Bestrafung fÃ¼r Sein Juden wÃ¤hrend des mittleren Alters gegenÃ¼ber. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Im 19. Jahrhundert verbreiteten Wellen des Antisemitismus Ã¼ber Osteuropa, in dem viel Jude lebte. Viele Juden wanderten zu den Vereinigten Staaten und zum Europa aus. Einige bewogen nach PalÃ¤stina, die Position des alten Landes von Israel. Diese Idee des Verursachens eines neuen jÃ¼dischen Zustandes wird Zionism genannt. Das Holocaust des Zweiten Weltkrieges, als sechs Million Juden ermordet wurden, fÃ¼gte der IntensitÃ¤t der Zionist Bewegung hinzu. Der Krieg lieÃ auch viele jÃ¼dische FlÃ¼chtlinge in Europa. Viele, die bevorzugt werden, um eine neue Nation herzustellen anstatt, bewegen auf neue HÃ¤user oder gehen zurÃ¼ck zu ihrem alten Land. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Die Nationen beachteten die Notwendigkeit an einer jÃ¼dischen Heimaten, und 1947, empfahl sie, daÃ PalÃ¤stina zu einen jÃ¼dischen Zustand gemacht wird. Am 14. Mai 1948 David Ben-Gurion, Israels erster Premierminister, UnabhÃ¤ngigkeit erklÃ¤rten Israels. Viele arabische LÃ¤nder setzten dieser Entscheidung entgegen, und dieses funkte die Jahre des Araber-Israelischen Konflikts, die kommen wÃ¼rden. Israel, da sich zu einer modernen Demokratie entwickelt hat und ist eins der leistungsfÃ¤higsten LÃ¤nder im Mittlere Osten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'Israele Ã¨ una piccola nazione nel Medio Oriente, situato nel sud-ovest Asia sul bordo del mare mediterraneo. Il dichiarare dell'Israele Ã¨ stato stabilito in 1948 come rifugio per gli ebrei universalmente. I fondatori del moderno dichiarano dell'Israele cercato per generare un nuovo paese di cui principii, abitudini ed il modo di vivere sarebbe ebreo. [PARAGRAPH: 2] I regni ebrei sono fiorito nella regione nei periodi antichi, ma prima di 1948, non ci era stato ebreo dichiara per 2.000 anni. Gli ebrei sono stati sparsi dappertutto dopo il Romans li avevano guidati fuori nel primo e secondo ANNUNCIO di secoli. Malgrado tutto questo oppression, gli ebrei non hanno dimenticato mai la terra dell'Israele. Gli ebrei sono collegati molto attentamente con la terra dell'Israele a causa di tutti gli eventi religiosi che si sono presentati nell'Israele. Ci erano inoltre eventi molto importanti nella storia nell'Israele, quali la distruzione del tempiale e dell'aumento e la caduta dei regni ebrei. Quando gli ebrei persecuted in Medio Evo, era la speranza di rinvio nell'Israele che le ha mantenute vive. [PARAGRAPH: 2] I Exodus dall'Egitto, cavo da Moses, conducono gli Ebrei alla terra antica dell'Israele. I Philistines hanno forzato gli Ebrei unire sotto un singolo capo, Saul, che conducono gli Ebrei alla vittoria sopra i Philistines. Saul Ã¨ considerare solitamente come il primo re ebraico. Saul Ã¨ stato seguito dal re David. David era un hero dall'infanzia, quando slain eyed la leone-bestia Goliath. David ha dichiarato Gerusalemme il capitale ed ha generato i militari potenti. David inoltre ha portato l'arca del patto a Gerusalemme, che ha contenuto due ridurre in pani di pietra su cui i dieci ordini sono stati scritti. Solomon ha seguito David. Solomon era un diplomatico matrice, che costruisce le strade, i fortresses e un palazzo reale. La maggior parte del famoso Ã¨ tempiale del Solomon, conosciuto come il tempiale di Solomon. Il tempiale di Solomon era il centro della religione ebrea in quel tempo [PARAGRAPH: 2] Le imposte elevate nell'Israele conducono alla divisione del regno. Il nord, Israele, trasportato la maggior parte della popolazione e del territorio. La piccola e parte del sud ha stato bene a Judah. L'Israele Ã¨ sopravvissuto per due secoli. Ã stato distrutto internamente ed Ã¨ stato interferito dagli imperi rivali. A 734 BC, i Assyrians hanno invaso l'Israele. Hanno ucciso molti Israelites ed exiled molto. Judah, ha avuto meno violenza che l'Israele. In 586 BC, Gerusalemme Ã¨ caduto ai Babylonians ed il tempiale di Solomon Ã¨ stato distrutto. Ma il Judeans ha rifiutato di dimenticare lÃ la patria di Judah. Il Judeans Ã¨ venuto insieme nelle riunioni che erano il precursore per gli synogogues. Ascoltato lÃ i prophets. Quando Cyrus il grande della Persia ha preso il controllo delle terre palestinesi, ha permesso che il Judeans rinviasse a lÃ atterra. Per 600 anni, ci era un altro ebreo dichiara. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Quando il Judeans ha rinviato nell'Israele, il processo di generazione del regno nuovo Ã¨ risultato essere duro. Ci erano difficoltÃ religiose nell'Israele. I non ebrei sono stati disprezzati nella societÃ di Judean. I nuovi prophets hanno dovuto insegnare che il dio non solo Ã¨ stato significato per gli ebrei, ma tutta la gente. Nel secolo di quarto BC, Alexander il grande ha sconfitto il paese. CiÃ² portata nelle abitudini pagan alla terra. Alcune gioventÃ¹ persino hanno abbandonato le tradizioni ebree. Un righello del Greco successivo, Antiochus Epiphanes, persecuted gli ebrei e le loro tradizioni. Sotto Judah Maccabee ed i suoi fratelli, una sommossa si Ã¨ svasata. In 165, l'ebrei dichiarano erano indipendenti ancora una volta. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Nel primo secolo BC, Roma ha conquistato l'ebreo dichiara. La regola de Roma era tirannica e una sommossa ebrea ha cominciato in ANNUNCIO 66. Le legioni romane hanno conquistato Gerusalemme dopo una resistenza lunga in ANNUNCIO 70. Il Romans ha distrutto il tempiale e tutta che rimanesse era la parete. Questa parete Ã¨ stato conosciuta come la parete lamentantesi ed Ã¨ il posto piÃ¹ santo per la preghiera per gli ebrei oggi. In ANNUNCIO 73, il Romans Masada conquistato e l'ebrei dichiarano sono stati distrutti. La gente ebrea era nel exile. Per molti anni, gli ebrei hanno affrontato la punizione horrible per essere ebrei durante Medio Evo. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Nel diciannovesimo secolo, le onde del anti-Semitism si sono sparse attraverso l'Europa Orientale, in cui molto l'ebreo ha vissuto. Molti ebrei hanno emigrato negli Stati Uniti e l'Europa. Alcuni si sono mossi nel Palestine, la posizione della terra antica dell'Israele. Questa idea di generazione dell'ebreo nuovo dichiara Ã¨ denominata Zionism. Il Holocaust della seconda guerra mondiale, quando sei milione ebrei sono stati assassinati, ha aggiunto all'intensitÃ del movimento sionistico. La guerra inoltre ha lasciato molti rifugiati ebrei in Europa. Molti preferiti per stabilire una nuova nazione piuttosto che si muovono verso le nuove sedi, o vanno di nuovo al loro vecchio paese. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Le Nazioni Unite hanno notato l'esigenza di una patria ebrea e in 1947, ha suggerito che il Palestine Ã¨ trasformato in un ebreo dichiara. Il 14 maggio 1948, David Ben-Gurion, primo ministro di perfezione dell'Israele, indipendenza dell'Israele dichiarato. Molti paesi arabi hanno opposto questa decisione e questo ha scintillato gli anni del conflitto Arabo-Israeliano che verrebbero. L'Israele poichÃ© si Ã¨ sviluppato in una democrazia moderna ed Ã¨ uno dei paesi piÃ¹ potenti nel Medio Oriente.
TEXT.Spanish: Israel es una naciÃ³n pequeÃ±a en el Oriente Medio, situado en el sudoeste Asia en el borde del mar mediterrÃ¡neo. El estado de Israel fue establecido en 1948 como refugio para los judÃ­os por todo el mundo. Los fundadores del estado moderno de Israel intentaron crear un paÃ­s nuevo que principios, costumbres, y manera de la vida serÃ­a judÃ­a. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Los reinos judÃ­os prosperaron en la regiÃ³n en Ã©pocas antiguas, pero antes de 1948, no habÃ­a habido estado judÃ­o por 2.000 aÃ±os. Dispersaron a los judÃ­os por todo el mundo despuÃ©s del Romans los habÃ­an conducido hacia fuera en el primer y segundo ANUNCIO de los siglos. A pesar de toda esta opresiÃ³n, los judÃ­os nunca se olvidaron de la tierra de Israel. Los judÃ­os estÃ¡n conectados de cerca con la tierra de Israel debido a todos los acontecimientos religiosos que ocurrieron en Israel. HabÃ­a tambiÃ©n acontecimientos muy importantes en historia en Israel, tal como la destrucciÃ³n del templo y de la subida y caÃ­da de reinos judÃ­os. Cuando persiguieron a los judÃ­os en las edades medias, era la esperanza de volver a Israel que las mantuvo vivas. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Los Ã©xodos fuera de Egipto, plomo de Moses, conducen a hebreos a la tierra antigua de Israel. Los Philistines forzaron a hebreos unir debajo de un solo lÃ­der, Saul, que conducen a hebreos a la victoria sobre los Philistines. Miran a Saul generalmente como el primer rey hebreo. A rey David siguiÃ³ a Saul. David era un hÃ©roe de la niÃ±ez, cuando Ã©l habÃ­a matado eyed la leÃ³n-bestia Goliath. David declarÃ³ JerusalÃ©n el capital, y creÃ³ a militares de gran alcance. David tambiÃ©n trajo la arca del convenio a JerusalÃ©n, que contuvo dos tabletas de piedra en las cuales los diez mandamientos fueron escritos. Solomon siguiÃ³ David. Solomon era un diplomata principal, que construye los caminos, las fortalezas, y un palacio real. La mayorÃ­a del famoso es templo de Solomon, conocido como el templo de Solomon. El templo de Solomon era el centro de la religiÃ³n judÃ­a en ese tiempo [PARAGRAPH: 2] Los altos impuestos en Israel conducen a la divisiÃ³n del reino. El norte, Israel, llevado la mayor parte de la poblaciÃ³n y el territorio. La porciÃ³n pequeÃ±a y meridional sintiÃ³ bien a Judah. Israel sobreviviÃ³ por dos siglos. Fue destruido internamente, y cogido por los imperios rivales. En 734 A.C., los asirios invadieron Israel. Mataron a muchos Israelites y exiliaron muchos mÃ¡s. Judah, tenÃ­a menos violencia que Israel. En 586 A.C., JerusalÃ©n cayÃ³ a los babilÃ³nico y el templo de Solomon fue destruido. Pero el Judeans rechazÃ³ olvidarse allÃ­ de la patria de Judah. El Judeans vino junto en las reuniones que eran el precursor para los synogogues. Escuchado allÃ­ los profetas. Cuando Cyrus el grande de Persia tomÃ³ el control de tierras palestinas, Ã©l permitiÃ³ que el Judeans volviera a allÃ­ aterriza. Por 600 aÃ±os, habÃ­a otro estado judÃ­o. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Cuando el Judeans volviÃ³ a Israel, el proceso de crear un nuevo reino demostrÃ³ ser duro. HabÃ­a apuros religiosos en Israel. Despreciaron a los no judÃ­o en la sociedad de Judean. Los nuevos profetas tuvieron que enseÃ±ar que significaron al dios no sÃ³lo para los judÃ­os, solamente toda la gente. En el cuarto siglo A.C., Alexander el grande derrotÃ³ el paÃ­s. Esto traÃ­da en costumbres pagan a la tierra. Algunas juventudes incluso abandonaron tradiciones judÃ­as. Un regla de un Griego mÃ¡s Ãºltimo, Antiochus Epiphanes, persiguiÃ³ los judÃ­os y sus tradiciones. Debajo de Judah Maccabee y sus hermanos, una rebeliÃ³n seÃ±alÃ³ por medio de luces. En 165, el estado judÃ­o era independiente de nuevo. [PARAGRAPH: 2] En el primer siglo A.C., Roma conquistÃ³ el estado judÃ­o. La regla de Roma era tirÃ¡nica, y una rebeliÃ³n judÃ­a comenzÃ³ en el ANUNCIO 66. Las legiones romanas conquistaron JerusalÃ©n despuÃ©s de una resistencia larga en el ANUNCIO 70. El Romans destruyÃ³ el templo, y toda que permanecÃ­a era la pared. Esta pared se sabÃ­a como la pared que se lamentaba, y es el lugar mÃ¡s santo para el rezo para los judÃ­os hoy. En el ANUNCIO 73, el Romans Masada conquistado, y el estado judÃ­o fueron destruidos. La gente judÃ­a estaba en exilio. Por muchos aÃ±os, los judÃ­os hicieron frente al castigo horrible para ser judÃ­os durante las edades medias. [PARAGRAPH: 2] En el diecinueveavo siglo, las ondas del anti-Semitism se separaron a travÃ©s de Europa Oriental, en donde mucho viviÃ³ el judÃ­o. Muchos judÃ­os emigraron a los Estados Unidos y a la Europa. Algunos se movieron a Palestina, la localizaciÃ³n de la tierra antigua de Israel. Esta idea de crear un nuevo estado judÃ­o se llama Zionism. El Holocaust de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, cuando asesinaron a seis millones de judÃ­os, agregÃ³ a la intensidad del movimiento sionista. La guerra tambiÃ©n dejÃ³ a muchos refugiados judÃ­os en Europa. Muchos preferidos para establecer una nueva naciÃ³n mÃ¡s bien que se mueven a los nuevos hogares, o van de nuevo a su viejo paÃ­s. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Los Naciones Unidas notaron la necesidad de una patria judÃ­a, y en 1947, recomendÃ³ que Palestina estÃ© dada vuelta en un estado judÃ­o. El 14 de mayo de 1948, David Ben-Gurion, primer primer ministro de Israel, independencia de Israel declarado. Muchos paÃ­ses Ã¡rabes opusieron esta decisiÃ³n, y Ã©ste chispeÃ³ los aÃ±os del conflicto Ãrabe-IsraelÃ­ que vendrÃ­an. Israel puesto que se ha convertido en una democracia moderna, y es uno de los paÃ­ses mÃ¡s de gran alcance de el Oriente Medio.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ancient Rome was a civilization that grew from a small agricultural community founded on the Italian Peninsula circa the 8th century BC to a colossal empire straddling the Mediterranean Sea. In its twelve-century existence, Roman civilization shifted from a monarchy, to a republic based on a combination of oligarchy and democracy, to an autocratic empire. It came to dominate Western Europe and the entire area surrounding the Mediterranean Sea through conquest and assimilation.[PARAGRAPH:2]Italia, under the Roman Republic and later Empire, was the name of the Italian Peninsula. During the Republic, Italia (which extended at the time from Rubicon to Calabria) was not a province, but rather the territory of the city of Rome, thus having a special status: for example, military commanders were not allowed to bring their armies within Italia, and Julius Caesar passing the Rubicon with his legions marked the start of the civil war. From the 3rd century, the Roman Empire went into decline. The western half of the empire, including Hispania, Gaul, and Italy, broke into independent kingdoms in the 5th century. The eastern empire, governed from Constantinople, is usually referred to as the Byzantine Empire after 476, the traditional date for the "fall of Rome" and for the subsequent onset of the Early Middle Ages, also known as the Dark Ages.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Italian history the rise of the Signorie is a phase often associated with the decline of the medieval commune system of government and the rise of the dynastic state. The composition and specific functions of the Signoria varied from city to city. In some states (such as Verona under the Della Scala family or Florence in the days of Cosimo de Medici and Lorenzo the Magnificent) the polity was what we would term today a single party state in which the dominant party had vested the Signoria of the state in a single family or dynasty.[PARAGRAPH:2]Italy at this time was notable for its merchant Republics, including the Republic of Florence and the Maritime Republics. They were city-states and they were generally republics in that they were formally independent, though most of them originated from territories once belonging to the Byzantine Empire (the main exceptions being Genoa and Pisa). All these cities during the time of their independence had similar (though not identical) systems of government in which the merchant class had considerable power. Although in practice these were oligarchical, and bore little resemblance to a modern democracy, the relative political freedom they afforded was conducive to academic and artistic advancement. The four classic Maritime Republics in Italy are Venice, Genoa, Pisa, Amalfi and they are always given in that order, reflecting the temporal sequence of their dominance. However, other towns in Italy also have a history of being Maritime Republics, though historically less prominent. These include Gaeta, Ancona, Molfetta, Trani and, in Dalmatia (under Italian cultural influence), Ragusa and Zara.[PARAGRAPH:2]The unique political structures of late Middle Ages Italy have led some to theorise that its unusual social climate allowed the emergence of a rare cultural efflorescence. Italy was divided into smaller city states and territories: the kingdom of Naples controlled the south, the Republic of Florence and the Papal States the centre, the Genoese and the Milanese the north and west, and the Venetians the east. Fifteenth-century Italy was one of the most urbanised areas in Europe. Most historians agree that the ideas that characterised the Renaissance had their origin in late 13th century Florence, in particular with the writings of Dante Alighieri (1265-1321), Francesco Petrarch (1304-1374) and Giovanni Boccaccio (c. 1313-1375), as well as the painting of Giotto di Bondone (1267-1337).[PARAGRAPH:2]The Renaissance was so called because it was a "rebirth" of certain classical ideas that had long been lost to Europe. It has been argued that the fuel for this rebirth was the rediscovery of ancient texts that had been forgotten by Western civilisation, but were preserved in some monastic libraries and in the Islamic world, and the translations of Greek and Arabic texts into Latin. Renaissance scholars such as Niccolò de' Niccoli and Poggio Bracciolini scoured the libraries in search of works by such classical authors as Plato, Cicero and Vitruvius. The works of ancient Greek and Hellenistic writers (such as Plato, Aristotle, Euclid, and Ptolemy) and Muslim scientists were imported into the Christian world, providing new intellectual material for European scholars.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1946 Vittorio Emanuele III's son, Umberto II, was forced to abdicate. Italy became a Republic after the result of a popular referendum held on June 2, 1946, a day celebrated since as Republic Day. This was the first election in Italy allowing women to vote. The Republican Constitution was approved and came into force on January 1, 1948.

[TAB]The Kanem-Bornu Empire existed in modern Chad and Nigeria. It was known to the Arab geographers as the Kanem Empire from the 9th century AD onward and lasted, in some form, until 1893. At its height it encompassed an area covering not only much of Chad, but also parts of modern southern Libya, eastern Niger, northeastern Nigeria and northern Cameroon. The Kanem Empire originated at an unknown period to the northeast of Lake Chad. It was located at the southern end of the trans-Saharan trade route between Tripoli and the region of Lake Chad. Besides its urban elite it included a confederation of nomadic peoples.[PARAGRAPH:2]The major factor that influenced the history of the state of Kanem was the early penetration of Islam. North African traders, Berbers and Arabs, brought the new religion. Towards 1068, Hummay, a member of the Sayfawa establishment, who was already a Muslim, discarded the last Duguwa king Selma from power and thus established the new dynasty of the Sayfuwa. Islam offered the Sayfawa rulers the advantage of new ideas from Arabia and the Mediterranean world, as well as literacy in administration. But many people resisted the new religion favouring traditional beliefs and practices. When Hummay had assumed power on the basis of his strong Islamic following, for example, it is believed that the Duguwa/Zaghawa began some kind of internal opposition. This pattern of conflict and compromise with Islam occurs repeatedly in Chadian history.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kanem-Bornu peaked during the reign of the outstanding statesman Mai Idris Aluma (c. 1571-1603). Aluma is remembered for his military skills, administrative reforms, and Islamic piety. His main adversaries were the Hausa to the west, the Tuareg and Toubou to the north, and the Bulala to the east. One epic poem extols his victories in 330 wars and more than 1,000 battles. His innovations included the employment of fixed military camps (with walls); permanent sieges and "scorched earth" tactics, where soldiers burned everything in their path; armored horses and riders; and the use of Berber camelry, Kotoko boatmen, and iron-helmeted musketeers trained by Turkish military advisers.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aluma introduced a number of legal and administrative reforms based on his religious beliefs and Islamic law (sharia). He sponsored the construction of numerous mosques and made a pilgrimage to Mecca, where he arranged for the establishment of a hostel to be used by pilgrims from his empire. As with other dynamic politicians, Aluma's reformist goals led him to seek loyal and competent advisers and allies, and he frequently relied on slaves who had been educated in noble homes. Aluma regularly sought advice from a council composed of heads of the most important clans. He required major political figures to live at the court, and he reinforced political alliances through appropriate marriages (Aluma himself was the son of a Kanuri father and a Bulala mother).[PARAGRAPH:2]Although the dynasty ended, the kingdom of Kanem-Bornu survived. But Umar, who eschewed the title mai for the simpler designation shehu (from the Arabic shaykh), could not match his father's vitality and gradually allowed the kingdom to be ruled by advisers (wazirs). Bornu began to decline, as a result of administrative disorganization, regional particularism, and attacks by the militant Ouaddai Empire to the east. The decline continued under Umar's sons, and in 1893 Rabih az-Zubayr, leading an invading army from eastern Sudan, conquered Bornu.

[TAB]Kazakhstan has been inhabited since the Stone Age: the region's climate and terrain are best suited for nomads practicing pastoralism. Historians believe that humans first domesticated the horse in the region's vast steppes. While ancient cities Taraz (Aulie-Ata) and Hazrat-e Turkestan had long served as important way-stations along the Silk Road connecting East and West, real political consolidation only began with the Mongol invasion of the early 13th century. Under the Mongol Empire, administrative districts were established, and these eventually came under the emergent Kazakh Khanate.[PARAGRAPH:2]During the 17th century Kazakhs fought Oirats, a federation of western Mongol tribes, among which the Dzungars were particularly aggressive. The beginning of the 18th century marked the zenith of the Kazakh Khanate. During this period the Little Horde participated in the 1723-1730 war against the Dzungars, following their "Great Disaster" invasion of Kazakh territories. Under leadership Abul Khair Khan the Kazakhs won major victories over the Dzungar at the Bulanty River, in 1726, and at the Battle of Anrakay in 1729.Ablai Khan participated in the most significant battles against the Dzungars from the 1720s to the 1750s, for which he was declared a "batyr" ("hero") by the people. Kazakhs were also a victims of constant raids carried out by the Volga Kalmyks.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Russian Empire introduced a system of administration and built military garrisons and barracks in its effort to establish a presence in Central Asia in the so-called "Great Game" between it and the British Empire. The first Russian outpost, Orsk, was built in 1735. Russia enforced the Russian language in all schools and governmental organisations. Russian efforts to impose its system aroused the extreme resentment by the Kazakh people, and by the 1860s, most Kazakhs resisted Russia's annexation largely because of the disruption it wrought upon the traditional nomadic lifestyle and livestock-based economy, and the associated hunger which was rapidly wiping out some Kazakh tribes. The Kazakh national movement, which began in the late 1800s, sought to preserve the native language and identity by resisting the attempts of the Russian Empire to assimilate and stifle them.[PARAGRAPH:2]Soviet repression of the traditional elite, along with forced collectivization in late 1920s-1930s, brought mass hunger and led to unrest. Between 1926 and 1939, the Kazakh population declined by 22%, due to starvation, violence and mass emigration. Today, the estimates suggest that the population of Kazakhstan would be closer to 20 million if there had been no starvation or massacre of Kazakhs. During the 1930s, many renowned Kazakh writers, thinkers, poets, politicians and historians were slaughtered on Stalin's orders, both as part of the repression and as a methodical pattern of suppressing Kazakh identity and culture. The Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic (SSR) contributed five national divisions to the Soviet Union's World War II effort.[PARAGRAPH:2]Caught up in the groundswell of Soviet republics seeking greater autonomy, Kazakhstan declared its sovereignty as a republic within the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics in October 1990. Following the August 1991 aborted coup attempt in Moscow and the subsequent dissolution of the Soviet Union, Kazakhstan declared independence on December 16, 1991. It was the last of the Soviet republics to declare independence.[PARAGRAPH:2]The years following independence have been marked by significant reforms to the Soviet-style economy and political monopoly on power. Under Nursultan Nazarbayev, who initially came to power in 1989 as the head of the Communist Party of Kazakhstan and was eventually elected President in 1991, Kazakhstan has made significant progress toward developing a market economy. The country has enjoyed significant economic growth since 2000, partly due to its large oil, gas, and mineral reserves. Democracy, however, has not gained much ground since 1991.

[TAB]In the seventh century, in the region between the Black Sea and the Caspian Sea, a free Jewish state was established. Its people were a mix of Khazar Turks, whom were part of the Gok Turkic Migration, the Huns, the Bulgars, and the Caucasians. The story of the Khazar Empire begins when the infant-empire Khagan Bulan heard from an Arab mullah, a Christian priest, and a Jewish rabbi on the reasons why Khazaria should adopt each of their religions. After much thought, Bulan decided to adopt the Jewish faith. Nowhere else in the world, has a non-Jewish nation undergone such a conversion as Bulan faced the Muslim expansion of the South, and the Christian expansion to the west. A few wars between the Khazars and Arabs prevented Islam from spreading across all of eastern Europe at a time when Islam was attracting many followers. It also became a place of safety and refuge for the Jewish people, as the rest of the world were persecuted.[PARAGRAPH: 1]Khazar power begins at about 650 BC, when the Turkic kingdom formed after the breakup of the Gok Turks and the collapse of their rival the Avars. Khazar culture was molded around the Gok Turks, with the Khagan holding supreme power and the Khagan Bek being the military power. The Khazars used a runic script that originated in Mongolia as their language. Most of the Turkish groups of the period used the same type of language.[PARAGRAPH: 1]Arab scholars of the time provide the most knowledge of the Khazars. An 11th century Muslim chronicler elaborated on the man who brought the Jewish faith to Khazaria. His writings explain how a single Khazar Jew, who had a high military rank, converted all the other Khazars to Judaism. The chronicler went on to explain how the Khazars observed Judaism. Obadiah, one of Bulan's descendants, consolidated the newly-adopted religion with the construction of synogogues and invited Jewish scholars to confine other doubters among the aristocracy. However, it was not only the military elite and the nobles who were converted. The common people embraced the new religion with open arms. Pagan shamanism was the Khazar's original religion, remained in place as were other religions. Incredibly, a seven-strong Supreme Court with representatives of all faiths was established to ensure fair hearing for all people. Such religious tolerance was unheard of.[PARAGRAPH: 1]Although the Khazars were nomadic people, the conversion to Judaism rapidly opted for a more settled existence with Khazaria prospering from farming, the production of goods, and trading. Khazaria also did play a role in the defeat of Persia in the 7th century, allying it self with the Turks and the Byzantines. There were also a series of wars in the 8th century against the Arabs that established Khazaria's southern borders at the Caucasus Mountains. However, the Khazars are associated with a period of peace along the steppe because they were more concerned with commerce than warfare.[PARAGRAPH: 1]The Khazars were very cooperative with their neighbors such that the Byzantines build a wall for them at the city of Sarkel along the Don River. Byzantine emperors Justinian II and Constantine V both took a Khazar wife. Khazar also brought many new technologies in since Jews from all over the world came in search of a Jewish beacon. All this helped to strengthen Khazaria and make it into a cosmopolitan and a progressive civilization.[PARAGRAPH: 1]At the empires greatest extent at 850, it stretched from the Black to the Caspian sea. The waterways were trading links and the Khazars built the city of Kiev, later becoming its capital. The most enduring of Khazar capitals was Itil. It had a trading post, an administrative center, and religious hearland for the Jews. It also had an Islamic mosque to serve the Muslim population. Khazar power ended under Svyatoslav, the ruler of Kiev. Khazaria was then taken over by the neighboring Pechenegs, Oghuz, and Byzantine peoples. Khazar traders faced difficult circumstances during these times and all mention of them ends. The Penchenegs who had much of Khazar land did not focus on trade, and disrupted the trade with Eastern Europe.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Au septiï¿½me siï¿½cle, dans la rï¿½gion entre la Mer Noire et la mer caspienne, un ï¿½tat juif libre a ï¿½tï¿½ ï¿½tabli. Ses personnes ï¿½taient un mï¿½lange des Turcs de Khazar, qui faisaient partie de la migration de Gok Turkic, les huns, le Bulgars, et les Caucasiens. L'histoire de l'empire de Khazar commence quand l'enfant en bas ï¿½ge-empire Khagan Bulan reï¿½u des nouvelles un mollah arabe, un prï¿½tre chrï¿½tien, et un rabbin juif sur les raisons pour lesquelles Khazaria devrait adopter chacune de leurs religions. Aprï¿½s beaucoup de pensï¿½e, Bulan a dï¿½cidï¿½ d'adopter la foi juive. Nulle part autrement dans le monde, a une nation non-Juive subie une telle conversion que Bulan a fait face ï¿½ l'expansion musulmane des sud, et l'expansion chrï¿½tienne ï¿½ l'ouest. Quelques guerres entre le Khazars et les Arabes ont empï¿½chï¿½ l'Islam d'ï¿½carter ï¿½ travers toute l'Europe de l'Est ï¿½ un moment oï¿½ l'Islam attirait beaucoup de disciples. C'est ï¿½galement devenu un endroit de la sï¿½retï¿½ et refuge pour les personnes juives, pendant que le reste du monde ï¿½taient persï¿½cutï¿½s. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La puissance de Khazar commence ï¿½ environ 650 AVANT Jï¿½SUS CHRIST, quand le royaume de Turkic a formï¿½ aprï¿½s la dissolution des Turcs de Gok et l'effondrement de leur rival l'Avars. La culture de Khazar a ï¿½tï¿½ moulï¿½e autour des Turcs de Gok, avec le Khagan tenant la puissance suprï¿½me et le Khagan Bek ï¿½tant la puissance militaire. Le Khazars a employï¿½ un manuscrit runic qui a provenu de la Mongolie en tant que leur langue. La plupart des groupes turcs de la pï¿½riode ont employï¿½ le mï¿½me type de langue. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Les disciples arabes du temps fournissent la plupart de connaissance du Khazars. Un chroniqueur musulman du 11ï¿½me siï¿½cle a ï¿½laborï¿½ sur l'homme qui a apportï¿½ la foi juive ï¿½ Khazaria. Ses ï¿½critures expliquent comment un juif simple de Khazar, qui a eu un rang ï¿½levï¿½ de militaires, a converti tout autre Khazars en judaï¿½sme. Le chroniqueur a continuï¿½ pour expliquer comment le Khazars a observï¿½ le judaï¿½sme. Obadiah, un des descendants de Bulan, a consolidï¿½ la religion nouveau-adoptï¿½e avec la construction des synogogues et a invitï¿½ les disciples juifs au confince d'autres douteurs parmi l'aristocratie. Cependant, c'ï¿½tait non seulement l'ï¿½lite militaire et les nobles qui ont ï¿½tï¿½ convertis. Les gens du commun ont embrassï¿½ la nouvelle religion avec les bras ouverts. Le shamanism paï¿½en ï¿½tait la religion originale du Khazar, restï¿½e en place de mï¿½me que d'autres religions. Incredibely, une cour suprï¿½me sept-forte avec des reprï¿½sentants de toutes les fois a ï¿½tï¿½ ï¿½tabli pour assurer l'audition juste pour toutes les personnes. Une telle tolï¿½rance religieuse ï¿½tait inconnue. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Bien que le Khazars aient ï¿½tï¿½ des personnes de nomadiv, la conversion en judaï¿½sme a rapidement optï¿½ pour un existance plus arrangï¿½ avec Khazaria prospï¿½rant de l'affermage, de la production des marchandises, et du commerce. Khazaria ï¿½galement a jouï¿½ un rï¿½le dans la dï¿½faite de Perse au 7ï¿½me siï¿½cle, l'alliant individu avec les Turcs et le Byzantines. Lï¿½ wer ï¿½galement qu'une sï¿½rie de guerres dans le 8ï¿½me centurey contre les Arabes qui ont ï¿½tabli le souther de Khazaria encadre aux montagnes de Caucase. Cependant, le Khazars sont associï¿½s ï¿½ une pï¿½riode de paix le long de la steppe parce qu'elles davantage ont ï¿½tï¿½ concernï¿½es par le commerce que la guerre. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le Khazars ï¿½taient trï¿½s coopertive avec leurs voisins tels que la construction de Byzantines un mur pour eux ï¿½ la ville de Sarkel le long du fleuve de Don. Les emporors bizantins Justinian II et Constantine V tous les deux ont pris une ï¿½pouse de Khazar. Khazar ï¿½galement a apportï¿½ beaucoup de nouvelles technologies dedans puisque les juifs de sont partout dans le monde venus ï¿½ la recherche d'une balise juive. Tout ceci a aidï¿½ ï¿½ renforcer Khazaria et ï¿½ le transformer en une civilisation cosmopolite et progressive. [PARAGRAPH : 1] ï¿½ la plus grande ampleur d'empires ï¿½ 850, il s'est ï¿½tendu du noir ï¿½ la mer caspienne. Les voies d'eau commerï¿½aient des liens et le Khazars a construit la ville de Kiev, devenant plus tard son capital. La rï¿½sistance des capitaux de Khazar ï¿½tait Itil. Elle a eu un comptoir commercial, un centre administratif, et le hearland religieux pour les juifs. Elle a ï¿½galement eu une mosquï¿½e islamique pour servir la population musulmane. La puissance de Khazar a fini sous Svyatoslav, la rï¿½gle de Kiev. Khazaria a ï¿½tï¿½ alors succï¿½dï¿½ par le Pechenegs voisin, l'Oghuz, et les peuples bizantins. Les commerï¿½ants de Khazar ont fait face ï¿½ des circonstances difficiles pendant ces pï¿½riodes et toute la mention de elles des extrï¿½mitï¿½s. Le Penchenegs qui a eu beaucoup de terre de Khazar ne s'est pas concentrï¿½ sur le commerce, et distrupted le commerce avec l'Europe de l'Est.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Im 7. Jahrhundert in der Region zwischen dem Schwarzen Meer und dem kaspischen Meer, wurde ein freier jï¿½discher Zustand hergestellt. Seine Leute waren eine Mischung der Khazar Tï¿½rken, die ein Teil der Gok Turkic Migration, die Hunnen, das Bulgars und die Kaukasier waren. Die Geschichte des Khazar Reiches fï¿½ngt wenn das Kindreich Khagan Bulan an, das von einem arabischen Mulla, von einem christlichen Priester und von einem jï¿½dischen Rabbiner auf den Grï¿½nden gehï¿½rt wird, warum Khazaria jede ihrer Religionen annehmen sollte. Nach vielem Gedanken entschied Bulan, den jï¿½dischen Glauben anzunehmen. Nirgendwo sonst in der Welt, hat eine nicht-Jï¿½dische Nation, die solch einer Umwandlung durchgemacht wird, der Bulan die moslemische Expansion des Sï¿½dens gegenï¿½berstellte, und der christlichen Expansion zum Westen. Einige Kriege zwischen dem Khazars und den Arabern verhinderten Islam am Verbreiten ï¿½ber den ganzen Osteuropa, zu einer Zeit als Islam viele Nachfolger anzog. Es wurde auch ein Ort der Sicherheit und Schutz fï¿½r die jï¿½dischen Leute, wï¿½hrend der Rest der Welt verfolgt wurden. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Khazar Energie fï¿½ngt an ungefï¿½hr 650 BC an, als das Turkic Kï¿½nigreich nach dem Auseinanderbrechen der Gok Tï¿½rken und dem Einsturz ihres Rivalen das Avars sich bildete. Khazar Kultur wurde um die Gok Tï¿½rken geformt, wenn das Khagan Oberste Energie hï¿½lt und dem Khagan Bek, das die militï¿½rische Energie ist. Das Khazars benutzte einen runic Index, der in Mongolei als ihre Sprache entstand. Die meisten tï¿½rkischen Gruppen der Periode benutzten die gleiche Art der Sprache. [PARAGRAPH: 3] Arabische Gelehrte der Zeit stellen das meiste Wissen des Khazars zur Verfï¿½gung. Ein moslemischer Chronist des 11. Jahrhunderts arbeitete auf dem Mann aus, der Khazaria den jï¿½dischen Glauben holte. Seine Schreiben erklï¿½ren, wie ein einzelner Khazar Jude, der einen hohen Militï¿½rrank hatte, alles andere Khazars in Judentum umwandelte. Der Chronist fuhr fort, zu erklï¿½ren, wie das Khazars Judentum beobachtete. Obadiah, einer von Nachkommen Bulans, vereinigte die neu-angenommene Religion mit dem Aufbau von synogogues und lud jï¿½dische Gelehrte zum confince andere Zweifler unter der Aristokratie ein. Jedoch war es nicht nur die militï¿½rische Auslese und die Adligen, die umgewandelt wurden. Die gewï¿½hnlichen Leute umfaï¿½ten die neue Religion mit den geï¿½ffneten Armen. Heidnisches shamanism war die des Khazars ursprï¿½ngliche Religion, an der richtigen Stelle geblieben, wie andere Religionen. Incredibely, ein sieben-starkes Hï¿½chstes Gericht mit Reprï¿½sentanten aller Glauben wurde hergestellt, um angemessene Hï¿½rfï¿½higkeit fï¿½r alle Leute sicherzustellen. Solche fromme Toleranz war von ungehï¿½rt. [PARAGRAPH: 4] Obgleich das Khazars nomadiv Leute waren, entschied die Umwandlung zum Judentum schnell fï¿½r ein vereinbartes existance mit Khazaria, das vom Bewirtschaften, von der Produktion von Waren und vom Handeln sich erweitert. Khazaria auch spielte eine Rolle in der Niederlage von Persien im 7. Jahrhundert und verband sie Selbst mit den Tï¿½rken und dem Byzantines. Dort wer, auch, das eine Reihe Kriege im 8. centurey gegen die Araber, die souther Khazarias herstellten, an den Kaukasus Bergen einfaï¿½t. Jedoch sind das Khazars mit einer Periode des Friedens entlang der Steppe verbunden, weil sie mehr mit Handel als Kriegsfï¿½hrung betroffen wurden. [PARAGRAPH: 5] Das Khazars waren mit ihren Nachbarn so daï¿½ der Byzantines Bau eine Wand fï¿½r sie an der Stadt von Sarkel entlang dem anziehenfluï¿½ sehr coopertive. Byzantinische emporors Justinian II und Constantine V beide nahmen eine Khazar Frau. Khazar holte auch viele neue Technologien innen, da Juden von auf der ganzen Erde auf der Suche nach einem jï¿½dischen Leuchtfeuer kamen. Alles half dieses, Khazaria zu verstï¿½rken und es in eine Welt- und progressive Zivilisation zu bilden. [PARAGRAPH: 6] Am grï¿½ï¿½ten Umfang der Reiche bei 850, dehnte er vom Schwarzen zum kaspischen Meer aus. Die Wassern-Strasse handelten Verbindungen und das Khazars errichtete die Stadt von Kiew und spï¿½ter wurde sein Kapital. Das Aushalten der Khazar Kapitalien war Itil. Es hatte einen handelnden Pfosten, eine Verwaltungsstelle und frommes hearland fï¿½r die Juden. Es hatte auch eine islamische Moschee, zum der moslemischen Bevï¿½lkerung zu dienen. Khazar Energie beendete unter Svyatoslav, die Lehre von Kiew. Khazaria wurde dann vom benachbarten Pechenegs, vom Oghuz und von den byzantinischen Vï¿½lkern ï¿½bernommen. Khazar Hï¿½ndler stellten schwierige Umstï¿½nde wï¿½hrend dieser Zeiten und aller Erwï¿½hnung von ihnen Enden gegenï¿½ber. Das Penchenegs, das viel von Khazar Land hatte, konzentrierte nicht auf Handel und distrupted den Handel mit Osteuropa.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Nel settimo secolo, nella regione fra il Mar Nero ed il mare caspico, un ebreo libero dichiara ï¿½ stato stabilito. La relativa gente era una miscela dei Turchi di Khazar, quale facevano parte dell'espansione di Gok Turkic, i Huns, il Bulgars ed i Caucasians. La storia dell'impero di Khazar comincia quando l'infante-impero Khagan Bulan ascoltato di un mullah arabo, di un priest cristiano e di un rabbi ebreo sulle ragioni per le quali Khazaria dovrebbe adottare ciascuna delle loro religioni. Dopo molto pensiero, Bulan ha deciso adottare la fede ebrea. In nessun posto altrimenti nel mondo, ha una nazione non-Ebrea subita una tal conversione come Bulan ha affrontato l'espansione musulmana del sud e l'espansione cristiana all'ovest. Alcune guerre fra il Khazars e gli arabi hanno impedito l'Islam la diffusione attraverso tutta l'Europa Orientale in un momento in cui l'Islam stava attraendo molti seguicamme. Inoltre si ï¿½ trasformato in in un posto di sicurezza ed in rifugio per la gente ebrea, mentre il resto del mondo persecuted. [PARAGRAPH: 2] L'alimentazione di Khazar comincia BC a circa 650, quando il regno di Turkic ha formato dopo il disfacimento dei Turchi di Gok ed il crollo del loro rivale il Avars. La coltura di Khazar ï¿½ stata modellata intorno ai Turchi di Gok, con l'alimentazione suprema della tenuta di Khagan e il Khagan Bek che ï¿½ l'alimentazione militare. Il Khazars ha usato uno scritto runic che ha provenuto in Mongolia come loro lingua. La maggior parte dei gruppi turchi del periodo hanno usato lo stesso tipo di lingua. [PARAGRAPH: 3] Gli eruditi arabi del tempo forniscono la maggior parte della conoscenza del Khazars. Un chronicler musulmano di undicesimo secolo ha elaborato sull'uomo che ha portato la fede ebrea a Khazaria. Le sue scritture spiegano come un singolo ebreo di Khazar, che ha avuto un alto Rank dei militari, ha convertito tutto il altro Khazars in Judaism. Il chronicler ha continuato a spiegare come il Khazars ha osservato il Judaism. Obadiah, uno dei discendenti del Bulan, ha consolidato la religione nuovo-adottata con la costruzione degli synogogues ed ha invitato gli eruditi ebrei al confince altri doubters fra il aristocracy. Tuttavia, era non solo l'elite militare ed i nobili che sono stati convertiti. La gente comune ha abbracciato la nuova religione con le armi aperte. Lo shamanism Pagan era la religione originale del Khazar, rimasta sul posto come erano altre religioni. Incredibely, una Corte suprema sette-forte con i rappresentanti di tutta la fede ï¿½ stato stabilito per accertare l'udienza giusta per tutta la gente. Tale tolleranza religiosa era unheard di. [PARAGRAPH: 4] Anche se il Khazars era la gente del nomadiv, la conversione a Judaism ha optato velocemente per un existance depositato con Khazaria che prospera dall'agricoltura, dalla produzione delle merci e dal commercio. Khazaria inoltre ha svolto un ruolo nella sconfitta della Persia nel settimo secolo, alleante lo auto con i Turchi e il Byzantines. Lï¿½ wer inoltre che una serie di guerre nell'ottavo centurey contro gli arabi che hanno stabilito il souther del Khazaria borders alle montagne del Caucaso. Tuttavia, il Khazars ï¿½ associato con un periodo di pace lungo la steppa perchï¿½ di piï¿½ sono state interessate del commercio che la guerra. [PARAGRAPH: 5] Il Khazars era molto coopertive con i loro vicini tali che la configurazione di Byzantines una parete per loro alla cittï¿½ di Sarkel lungo il fiume di indoss. I emporors Byzantine Justinian II e Constantine V entrambi hanno preso una moglie di Khazar. Khazar inoltre ha portato molte nuove tecnologie dentro poichï¿½ gli ebrei da dappertutto sono venuto alla ricerca di un falï¿½ ebreo. Tutto questo ha contribuito a rinforzare Khazaria e trasformarlo una civilizzazione cosmopolita e progressiva. [PARAGRAPH: 6] Al limite piï¿½ grande degli imperi a 850, ha allungato dal nero al mare caspico. I canali navigabili stavano commerciando i collegamenti e il Khazars ha costruito la cittï¿½ di Kiev, successivamente trasformantesi nel relativo capitale. Resistere dei capitali di Khazar era Itil. Ha avuto un alberino di commercio, un centro amministrativo e hearland religioso per gli ebrei. Inoltre ha avuto un mosque islamico per servire la popolazione musulmana. L'alimentazione di Khazar si ï¿½ conclusa sotto Svyatoslav, il righello di Kiev. Khazaria allora ï¿½ stato rilevato dal Pechenegs vicino, dal Oghuz e dalla gente Byzantine. I commercianti di Khazar hanno affrontato le circostanze difficili durante questi periodi e tutta la menzione di loro estremitï¿½. Il Penchenegs che ha avuto molta della terra di Khazar non ha messo a fuoco su commercio e distrupted il commercio con l'Europa Orientale.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En el sï¿½ptimo siglo, en la regiï¿½n entre el Mar Negro y el mar caspio, un estado judï¿½o libre fue establecido. Su gente era una mezcla de los turcos de Khazar, que eran parte de la migraciï¿½n de Gok Turkic, los Huns, el Bulgars, y los caucï¿½sicos. La historia del imperio de Khazar comienza cuando el infante-imperio Khagan Bulan recibido noticias un mullah ï¿½rabe, un sacerdote cristiano, y un rabino judï¿½o en las razones por las que Khazaria debe adoptar cada uno de sus religiones. Despuï¿½s de mucho pensamiento, Bulan decidï¿½a a adoptar la fe judï¿½a. En ninguna parte en el mundo, tiene una naciï¿½n no-Judï¿½a experimentada una conversiï¿½n tal que Bulan hizo frente a la extensiï¿½n musulmana del sur, y la extensiï¿½n cristiana al oeste. Algunas guerras entre el Khazars y los ï¿½rabes evitaron que el Islam se separara a travï¿½s de toda la Europa Oriental en un momento en que el Islam atraï¿½a muchos seguidores. Tambiï¿½n se convirtiï¿½ en un lugar de la seguridad y refugio para la gente judï¿½a, mientras que el resto del mundo fue perseguido. [PARAGRAPH: 2] La energï¿½a de Khazar comienza aproximadamente 650 A.C., cuando el reino de Turkic formï¿½ despuï¿½s de la desintegraciï¿½n de los turcos de Gok y del derrumbamiento de su rival el Avars. La cultura de Khazar fue moldeada alrededor de los turcos de Gok, con el Khagan llevando a cabo energï¿½a suprema y el Khagan Bek que era la energï¿½a militar. El Khazars utilizï¿½ una escritura runic que originï¿½ en Mongolia como su lengua. La mayor parte de los grupos turcos del perï¿½odo utilizaron el mismo tipo de lengua. [PARAGRAPH: 3] Los eruditos ï¿½rabes del tiempo proporcionan la mayorï¿½a del conocimiento del Khazars. Un cronista musulmï¿½n del 11mo siglo elaborï¿½ en el hombre que trajo la fe judï¿½a a Khazaria. Sus escrituras explican cï¿½mo un solo judï¿½o de Khazar, que tenï¿½a una alta fila de los militares, convirtiï¿½ todo el otro Khazars al judaï¿½smo. El cronista se encendiï¿½ explicar cï¿½mo el Khazars observï¿½ judaï¿½smo. Obadiah, uno de los descendientes de Bulan, consolidï¿½ la religiï¿½n nuevo-adoptada con la construcciï¿½n de synogogues e invitï¿½ a eruditos judï¿½os al confince otros doubters entre la aristocracia. Sin embargo, era no sï¿½lo la ï¿½lite militar y los nobles que fueron convertidos. El pueblo abrazï¿½ la nueva religiï¿½n con los brazos abiertos. El shamanism Pagan era la religiï¿½n original del Khazar, permanecida en lugar al igual que otras religiones. Incredibely, un Tribunal Supremo siete-fuerte con los representantes de todas las fes fue establecido para asegurar la audiencia justa para toda la gente. Tal tolerancia religiosa era unheard de. [PARAGRAPH: 4] Aunque el Khazars era gente del nomadiv, la conversiï¿½n al judaï¿½smo optï¿½ rï¿½pidamente por un existance colocado con Khazaria que prosperaba de cultivar, de la producciï¿½n de mercancï¿½as, y de negociar. Khazaria tambiï¿½n desempeï¿½ï¿½ un papel en la derrota de Persia en el 7mo siglo, aliï¿½ndolo uno mismo con los turcos y el Byzantines. Allï¿½ wer tambiï¿½n que una serie de guerras en el 8vo centurey contra los ï¿½rabes que establecieron el souther de Khazaria confina en las montaï¿½as del Cï¿½ucaso. Sin embargo, el Khazars se asocia a un perï¿½odo de la paz a lo largo de la estepa porque fueron referidas mï¿½s a comercio que la guerra. [PARAGRAPH: 5] El Khazars era muy coopertive con sus vecinos tales que la estructura de Byzantines una pared para ellos en la ciudad de Sarkel a lo largo del rï¿½o del poner. Los emporors Byzantine Justinian II y Constantina V ambos tomaron a esposa de Khazar. Khazar tambiï¿½n trajo muchas nuevas tecnologï¿½as adentro puesto que los judï¿½os de por todo el mundo vinieron en busca de un faro judï¿½o. Todo el esto ayudï¿½ a consolidar Khazaria y a hacerlo en una civilizaciï¿½n cosmopolita y progresiva. [PARAGRAPH: 6] En el grado mï¿½s grande de los imperios en 850, estirï¿½ del negro al mar caspio. Los canales negociaban acoplamientos y el Khazars construyï¿½ la ciudad de Kiev, convirtiï¿½ndose en mï¿½s adelante su capital. El aguantar de los capitales de Khazar era Itil. Tenï¿½a un poste que negociaba, un centro administrativo, y hearland religioso para los judï¿½os. Tambiï¿½n tenï¿½a una mezquita islï¿½mica para servir a la poblaciï¿½n musulmana. La energï¿½a de Khazar terminï¿½ debajo de Svyatoslav, la regla de Kiev. Khazaria entonces fue asumido el control por el Pechenegs vecino, el Oghuz, y la gente Byzantine. Los comerciantes de Khazar hicieron frente a circunstancias difï¿½ciles durante estas ï¿½pocas y toda la menciï¿½n de ellas los extremos. El Penchenegs que tenï¿½a mucha de tierra de Khazar no se centrï¿½ en comercio, y distrupted el comercio con Europa Oriental.

TEXT.English: Latvia; Latvian: Latvija, officially the Republic of Latvia (Latvian: Latvijas Republika) is a country in Northern Europe in the Baltic region. It is bordered to the north by Estonia (343 km), to the south by Lithuania (588 km), and to the east both by Belarus (141 km) and the Russian Federation (276 km). Across the Baltic Sea to the west lies Sweden. The territory of Latvia covers 64,589 kmï¿½ and is influenced by a temperate seasonal climate.The Latvians are a Baltic people closely related to the Lithuanians, with the Latvian language sharing many similarities to Lithuanian. Today the Latvians and Lithuanians are the only surviving members of the Baltic peoples and Baltic languages of the Indo-European family. The modern name of Latvia is thought to originate from the ancient Latvian name Latvji, which may have originated from the river named Latva or Latuva, which may be today's Lates upe.Latvia is a democratic parliamentary republic and is divided into 26 districts. The capital and largest city is Riga. Latvia has been a member of the United Nations since 17 September 1991, of the European Union since 1 May 2004 and of NATO since 29 March 2004.The Vikings invaded the area now known as Latvia in the 9th century, which was ruled by pagan Baltic tribes and stood on a trading crossroads between Scandinavia and Russia. The Russians attacked in the 10th century. The invasion of the Teutonic Knights (German crusaders) in the 13th century was resisted in a lengthy struggle, but Latvia eventually came under their control in 1230, converted to Christianity, and was governed by them for more than 200 years. By 1562 Poland and Lithuania had taken over most of the country. Sweden conquered the north in 1621 and Russia took over control of this area in 1710. By 1800 all of Latvia had come under Russian control. Serfdom was abolished between 1817-19 and the country became increasingly urbanized. A Latvian nationalist movement began to emerge in the mid 19th century and grew from the 1890s.

TEXT.English: [TAB] The Lithuanian tribes were first united under Duke Mindaugas in about 1230. In 1251, Mindaugas was converted to Christianity and crowned king. However, his nobles revolted and killed him, and Lithuania was returned to the pagan worship of nature. In 1387, the Grand Duke Jogaila accepted the Polish crown and created a personal alliance with Poland. He converted to Christianity, and with the help of his cousin, Grand Duke Vytautas, converted the Lithuanians to Christianity. Lithuania expanded greatly under the reign of Vytautas, earning him the title "the Great." [PARAGRAPH: 1] In 1795, in the concluding division of Poland, Lithuania was taken over by the Russian Empire. A Lithuanian nationalist movement began in the 1800s. After the Russian Empire was removed from power, Lithuania proclaimed its independence on February 16, 1918. When World War II broke out in 1939, Lithuania declared itself neutral. In 1940, however, as a result of a secret pact between Nazi German and Soviet leaders, Lithuania was occupied by the Soviet Union. Aside from the interval of German occupation from 1941 to 1944, Lithuania was to remain a Soviet republic until 1991. Lithuanian armed resistance to the Soviets caused tens of thousands of casualties. The Soviets deported an estimated 300,000 people, held back freedoms, and made the country economically dependent on the Soviet Union. [PARAGRAPH: 1] In the middle of the 1980s, Mikhail Gorbachev came to power in the Soviet Union and began a series of liberal reforms. In 1988, Lithuanians organized their own reform movement, called Sajudis. It gained a large amount of support in the country and was able to dictate the Lithuanian Communist party, which broke with the Soviet Communists in 1989. In multiparty elections for a new parliament in 1990, Sajudis was victorious. Lithuanian independence was restored, and Vytautas Landbergis was elected president. Gorbachev responded with an economic blockade and a show of military force, both of which failed. In 1991, Gorbachev recognized the independence of Lithuania, just a few months before the collapse of the Soviet Union itself. In the 1992 elections, the Democratic Labor Party won one third of the seats in parliament. Presidential elections in 1993 resulted in a victory for the leader of the party, Algirdas Brazauskas, over Landsbergis. In 1995, Sajudis regained a majority of the seats in parliament.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Le lituanien tribus ont d'abord été réunis sous Duc Mindaugas dans environ 1230. En 1251, Mindaugas se convertit au christianisme et couronné roi. Toutefois, ses nobles révoltés et l'a tué, et la Lituanie a été retourné à l'adoration païenne de la nature. En 1387, le Grand Duc Jogaila accepté la couronne polonaise et ont créé une alliance personnelle avec la Pologne. Il a converti au christianisme, et avec l'aide de son cousin, le Grand-Duc Vytautas, les Lituaniens converti au christianisme. La Lituanie a pris beaucoup d'ampleur sous le règne de Vytautas, gagner le titre "le Grand". [PARAGRAPH 1] En 1795, dans la dernière division de la Pologne, la Lituanie a été repris par l'Empire russe. Un mouvement nationaliste lituanien a commencé dans les années 1800. Après l'Empire russe a été écarté du pouvoir, de la Lituanie a proclamé son indépendance le 16 février 1918. Lorsque la Seconde Guerre mondiale éclata en 1939, la Lituanie se déclarait neutre. En 1940, cependant, à la suite d'un pacte secret entre l'Allemagne nazie et les dirigeants soviétiques, la Lituanie fut occupée par l'Union soviétique. En dehors de l'intervalle de l'occupation allemande de 1941 à 1944, la Lituanie a été de rester une république soviétique jusqu'en 1991. Lituanien résistance armée aux Soviétiques ont fait des dizaines de milliers de victimes. Les Soviétiques ont déporté un montant estimatif de 300000 personnes, bloquées libertés, et fait de ce pays économiquement dépendants de l'Union soviétique. [PARAGRAPH 1] Au milieu des années 1980, Mikhail Gorbatchev est arrivé au pouvoir en Union soviétique et il a commencé une série de réformes libérales. En 1988, les Lituaniens ont organisé leur propre mouvement de réforme, appelé Sajudis. Elle a acquis une grande quantité de soutien dans le pays et a été en mesure de dicter le parti communiste lituanien, qui a rompu avec le communisme soviétique, en 1989. Dans élections multipartites pour un nouveau parlement en 1990, Sajudis a été victorieux. L'indépendance lituanienne a été restauré, et Vytautas Landbergis a été élu président. Gorbatchev a répondu par un blocus économique et une démonstration de force militaire, qui a échoué. En 1991, Gorbatchev a reconnu l'indépendance de la Lituanie, juste quelques mois avant l'effondrement de l'Union soviétique elle-même. Dans les élections de 1992, la Democratic Labor Party a remporté un tiers des sièges au parlement. Les élections présidentielles en 1993 a abouti à une victoire pour le chef du parti, Algirdas Brazauskas, plus Landsbergis. En 1995, Sajudis a retrouvé la majorité des sièges au parlement.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die litauische Stämme wurden erstmals vereint unter Herzog Mindaugas in etwa 1230. In 1251, Mindaugas war zum Christentum konvertiert und zur Königin gekrönt. Doch sein Adel aufgelehnt und tötete ihn, und Litauen war wieder in den heidnischen Kultstätte der Natur. In 1387, der Großherzog Wladyslaw II. Jagiello die polnische Krone akzeptiert und erstellt ein persönliches Bündnis mit Polen. Er konvertierte zum Christentum, und mit der Hilfe von seinem Cousin, Großherzog Vytautas, konvertiert die Litauer zum Christentum. Litauen stark erweitert unter der Herrschaft von Vytautas, verdient er den Titel "der Große". [PARAGRAPH: 1] In 1795, in der abschließenden Teilung von Polen, Litauen wurde von der Russischen Reiches. Eine litauische nationalistische Bewegung begann in den 1800er. Nach dem Russischen Reich wurde von der Macht entfernt, Litauen seine Unabhängigkeit am 16. Februar 1918. Wenn dem Zweiten Weltkrieg brach in 1939, Litauen erklärte sich neutral. In 1940 jedoch, als das Ergebnis eines geheimen Pakt zwischen Nazi-Deutschland und sowjetische Führer, Litauen wurde von der Sowjetunion besetzt. Neben dem Abstand von der deutschen Besatzung von 1941 bis 1944, wurde Litauen zu bleiben einer Sowjetrepublik bis 1991. Litauisch bewaffneten Widerstand gegen die Sowjets verursachten Zehntausende von Toten. Die Sowjets deportiert schätzungsweise 300000 Menschen, held back Freiheiten, und das Land wirtschaftlich abhängig von der Sowjetunion. [PARAGRAPH: 1] In der Mitte der 1980er Jahre, Michail Gorbatschow an die Macht kam in der Sowjetunion und begann eine Reihe von liberalen Reformen. In 1988, Litauer organisierten ihre eigenen Reform-Bewegung, genannt Sajudis. Er gewann ein großes Maß an Unterstützung des Landes und war in der Lage zu diktieren die litauische Kommunistische Partei, die zum Bruch mit der sowjetischen Kommunisten im Jahr 1989. In Mehrparteien-Wahlen für ein neues Parlament in 1990, Sajudis war siegreich. Litauischen Unabhängigkeit wiederhergestellt wurde, und Vytautas Landbergis wurde zum Präsidenten gewählt. Gorbatschow reagierte mit einer wirtschaftlichen Blockade und eine Ausstellung von militärischer Gewalt, die beide nicht. In 1991, Gorbatschow erkannte die Unabhängigkeit von Litauen, der nur wenige Monate vor dem Zusammenbruch der Sowjetunion. In den Wahlen 1992, der Demokratischen Arbeiterpartei gewann ein Drittel der Sitze im Parlament. Präsidentschaftswahlen im Jahr 1993 führte zu einem Sieg für die Führer der Partei, Algirdas Brazauskas, über Landsbergis. In 1995, Sajudis wieder eine Mehrheit der Sitze im Parlament.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Il lituano prime tribù erano uniti sotto Duca Mindaugas in circa 1230. Nel 1251, Mindaugas è stato convertito al cristianesimo e incoronato re. Tuttavia, la sua nobiltà ribellati e lo uccise, e la Lituania è stata restituita al culto pagano della natura. Nel 1387, il Granduca Jogaila accettato la corona polacca e creato un personale alleanza con la Polonia. Egli ha convertito al cristianesimo, e con l'aiuto di suo cugino, il Granduca Vytautas, i lituani convertito al cristianesimo. Lituania ampliato enormemente sotto il regno di Vytautas, lui a guadagnare il titolo di "Grande". [PARAGRAPH: 1] Nel 1795, e la conclusione di divisione della Polonia, la Lituania è stato ripreso dal russo. Un movimento nazionalista lituano ha avuto inizio nel 1800. Dopo l'impero russo è stato rimosso dal potere, la Lituania ha proclamato la sua indipendenza il 16 febbraio 1918. Quando la seconda guerra mondiale scoppiò nel 1939, la Lituania si è dichiarato neutrale. Nel 1940, tuttavia, a seguito di un patto segreto tra nazista tedesco e leader sovietico, la Lituania fu occupata dall'Unione Sovietica. A parte l'intervallo di occupazione tedesca dal 1941 al 1944, la Lituania è stato quello di rimanere una repubblica sovietica fino al 1991. Lituano resistenza armata per i sovietici causato decine di migliaia di vittime. I sovietici deportati, secondo le stime, 300000 persone, frenato libertà, e di fatto il paese economicamente dipendente da parte dell'Unione Sovietica. [PARAGRAPH: 1] A metà degli anni 1980, Mikhail Gorbaciov è salito al potere in Unione Sovietica, e ha iniziato una serie di riforme liberiste. Nel 1988, lituani organizzato il proprio movimento di riforma, chiamato Sajudis. Ha guadagnato una grande quantità di sostegno nel paese ed è stato in grado di dettare il lituano partito comunista, che ha rotto con i comunisti sovietici nel 1989. In multipartitico elezioni per un nuovo parlamento nel 1990, è stato Sajudis vittorioso. Lituano indipendenza è stata restaurata, e Vytautas Landbergis venne eletto presidente. Gorbaciov ha risposto con un blocco economico e una dimostrazione di forza militare, di cui sia venuta meno. Nel 1991, Gorbaciov ha riconosciuto l'indipendenza della Lituania, a pochi mesi prima del crollo dell'Unione Sovietica. Nel 1992 le elezioni, il Partito Democratico del Lavoro ha vinto un terzo dei seggi in parlamento. Elezioni presidenziali nel 1993, ha determinato una vittoria per il leader del partito, Algirdas Brazauskas, oltre Landsbergis. Nel 1995, Sajudis riconquistato la maggioranza dei seggi in parlamento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] El lituano tribus fueron unidas bajo Duque Mindaugas en cerca de 1230. En 1251, Mindaugas se convirtió al cristianismo y coronado rey. Sin embargo, sus nobles se sublevaron y lo mató, y fue devuelto a Lituania el culto pagano de la naturaleza. En 1387, el Gran Duque Jogaila polaco aceptó la corona y creó una alianza personal con Polonia. Él se convirtió al cristianismo, y con la ayuda de su primo, el Gran Duque Vytautas, convirtió a los lituanos al cristianismo. Lituania ampliado enormemente bajo el reinado de Vytautas, le gana el título de "el Grande". [PARAGRAPH: 1] En 1795, en la conclusión de la división de Polonia, Lituania fue asumida por el imperio ruso. Un movimiento nacionalista lituano comenzó en el 1800. Después de que el imperio ruso fue removido del poder, Lituania proclamó su independencia el 16 de febrero de 1918. Cuando la II Guerra Mundial estalló en 1939, Lituania se declaró neutral. En 1940, sin embargo, como resultado de un pacto secreto entre los nazis alemanes y los dirigentes soviéticos, Lituania fue ocupada por la Unión Soviética. Aparte de la ocupación alemana del intervalo de 1941 a 1944, Lituania ha de seguir siendo una república soviética hasta 1991. Lituano resistencia armada a los soviéticos causado decenas de miles de bajas. Los soviéticos deportados un estimado de 300000 personas, que se celebró de nuevo las libertades, y de hecho el país dependen económicamente de la Unión Soviética. [PARAGRAPH: 1] A mediados de la década de 1980, Mijail Gorbachov llegó al poder en la Unión Soviética e inició una serie de reformas liberales. En 1988, los lituanos organizado su propio movimiento de reforma, llamado Sajudis. Obtuvo una gran cantidad de apoyo en el país y está en condiciones de dictar el partido comunista lituano, que rompió con los comunistas soviéticos, en 1989. En las elecciones multipartidistas para un nuevo parlamento en 1990, fue victorioso Sajudis. Se restableció la independencia de Lituania, Vytautas Landbergis y fue elegido presidente. Gorbachov respondió con un bloqueo económico y una demostración de la fuerza militar, que fracasó. En 1991, Gorbachov reconoce la independencia de Lituania, a sólo unos meses antes del colapso de la Unión Soviética. En las elecciones de 1992, el Partido Laborista Democrático ganó un tercio de los escaños en el parlamento. Las elecciones presidenciales en 1993 resultó en una victoria para el líder del partido, Algirdas Brazauskas, a lo largo de Landsbergis. En 1995, el Sajudis recuperó la mayoría de los escaños en el Parlamento.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The history of the Langobards begins with a small tribe known as the Winniler. The Winniler dwelled on a Nordic Island called Scanan. The Winniler were split into three groups, and the third moved out of the original land. The departing people were lead by brother Ybor and Aio and their mother Gambara. They arrived on the lands of Scoringa, which was ruled by Wandals. At the moment, the people of Scoringa were forced to either pay tribute, or go to war. The Winniler chose to go to war, and because they had such few numbers, women were forced to fight alongside men. The women tied their hair in front of their faces. When they were spotted, many noticed their long beards. From this moment on, the Winniler were known as the Langobard, which is Latinized to Langobards. [PARAGRAPH: 2] The Langobard dwelt near the river Elbe next to the Chauci. Archaeological finds show that early Langobard society revolved around agriculture. The first mention of the Langobards occurred between 9 and 16 AD. They were mentioned by the Roman court historian Velleius Paterculus. Paterculus described them as being "fiercer than normal German savagery." The Langobards were assumed as a Seubian tribe, subjects of King Marobod of the Marcomanni. The Marcomanni at the time made peace with the Romans, and that is why the Langobards were not part of the German confederacy. [PARAGRAPH: 2] In the second century, the Langobards appear in Rhineland. The Langobard had greatly expanded during this time. Just before the year 166, the Langobards and Obii crossed the Danube and invaded Pannonia. The Langobards lost the war, and returned back to their homes on the river Elbe. After this time, the Langobards seem to disappear from history. One reason is that the Langobards could have delved deeper into the Germanic lands. While some Langobard migrated, others were absorbed by the surrounding Saxons. Shortly after, the Langobards rose up against the Saxons with their king Agelmund. The Langobards began on another migration. [PARAGRAPH: 2] The crossing into Mauringa was difficult because the Usipetes denied the Langobards passage. Because of this, a fight was arranged between the strongest men of each tribe. The Langobards left the fight as victors, and their passage was granted. The Langobards reached Mauringa, and the first king, Agelmund, ruled for thirty years. The Langobards then departed from Mauringa and arrived at Golanda. The Golanda was a land on the bank of the Oder. Leaving Golanda, the Langobards passed through Anthaib and Banthaib until they at last reached Vurgundaib. The Huns attacked the Langobards, and killed their King Agelmund. The Langobards rose up against the Huns under the new king Laimicho. [PARAGRAPH: 2] In the year 560, a new king emerged who would mark a turning point in Langobard history, Alboin. Alboin defeated the Gepids, made them his subjects and led the Langobards and a federation of other tribes across the Julian Alps to invade Italy. The first important city to fall was Forum Iulii, in which he created the first Langobard duchy. His nephew, Gisulph, was to be the duke. In the summer of 569, the Langobards conquered Milan, which at the time was in terrible condition because of the Gothic Wars. Pavia fell under siege after three years, becoming the first capital of the new Langobard kingdom. In the upcoming years, the Langobards established two duchies further south, Spoleto and Benevento. The Byzantines managed to retain control of Ravenna and Rome. [PARAGRAPH: 2] The Langobard territory was divided into 36 duchies. The king ruled over them and administered the land through representatives called gastaldi. This unity was however weak, and the Langobards lost control over Spoleto and Benevento to the Franks over time. The deaths of Alboin and his son Cleph resulted in a ten year interregnum known as the "Rule of the Dukes". The dukes, threatened by the Franks, elected the son of Cleph, Authari, their next king. Authari tried to reorganize the royal administration, and manage to end the dangerous alliance between the Byzantines and the Franks. After Authari's death in 590, Agilulf, duke of Turin, ruled. He successfully fought the rebels from Northern Italy and conquered Padua and Mantua. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Rothari, the next ruler, extended the kingdom by conquering Ligura and the remaining part of the Byzantine territories of Veneto. Rothari also wrote the laws of his people in Latin. Rothari's son, Rodoald, succeeded him but was killed by the Catholic party. After the death of Aripert in 661, the kingdom was divided between his children. The capitals were in Milan and Pavia. Gromoald overthrew Perctarit, ruler of the Milan-centered Langobardia, and defeated the Franks and conquered southern Italy. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Religious troubles remained the source of struggle in the following years. The Langobards managed to gain control over Spoleto and Benevento. They also helped the Frankish Marshall Charles Martel drive back the Arabs. Aistulf conquered Ravenna for the first time, but was defeated by the king of the Franks, Pippin III. The last Langobard king to rule was Desiderius, duke of Tuscany. He attempted to prevent the Pope from attacking, and entered Rome for the first time. Charlemagne continued to defeat the Langobards on countless occasions to follow. Charlemagne took the title "King of the Langobards". [PARAGRAPH: 2] The Langobards of Southern Italy had not yet been conquered by Charlemagne, and made several attempts to produce a king with little success. The Langobards of Sothern Italy were now claimed by two empires, the Carolingian and Byzantine. Benevento at this time grew to it greatest extent. Langobard culture became embedded in formerly Greek Apulia. A civil war spread throughout Langobard lands for ten years after Emperor Louis II, the only Frankish king to exercise power over the Langobard states, imposed a peace treaty. The kingdom was divided into two states into the Principalities of Benevento of Salerno. Arabs began conquering Langobard cities and lands. The papacy began absorbing the remaining Langobard lands, which over time was losing their power. The remnants of the Langobards can still be seen in the modern Langobardy region of Italy.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'histoire du Langobards commence par une petite tribu connue sous le nom de Winniler. Le Winniler a demeuré sur une île nordique appelée Scanan. Le Winniler ont été coupés en trois groupes, et le tiers ont été déplacés hors de la terre originale. Les personnes partantes étaient fil par le frère Ybor et Aio et leur mère Gambara. Elles sont arrivées sur les terres de Scoringa, qui a été régné par Wandals. Au moment où, les personnes de Scoringa ont été forcées ou à l'hommage de salaire, ou aller faire la guerre. Le Winniler a choisi d'aller faire la guerre, et parce qu'elles ont eu de tels quelques nombres, des femmes ont été forcées de combattre à côté des hommes. Les femmes ont attaché leurs cheveux devant leurs visages. Quand elles ont été repèrées, beaucoup ont noté leurs longues barbes. À partir de ce moment dorénavant, le Winniler ont été connus comme Langobard, qui est Latinized à Langobards. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le Langobard a demeuré près du fleuve Elbe à côté du Chauci. Les trouvailles archéologiques prouvent que la première société de Langobard a tourné autour de l'agriculture. La première mention du Langobards s'est produite entre 9 et 16 APRÈS JÉSUS CHRIST. Ils ont été mentionnés par l'historien romain Velleius Paterculus de cour. Paterculus les a décrits en tant qu'étant « une sauvagerie allemande plus féroce que normalement. » Le Langobards ont été assumés comme tribu de Seubian, sujets du Roi Marobod du Marcomanni. Le Marcomanni a alors fait la paix avec le Romans, et c'est pourquoi le Langobards n'étaient pas une partie de la confédération allemande. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Au deuxième siècle, le Langobards apparaissent en Rhénanie. Le Langobard avait considérablement augmenté pendant ce temps. Juste avant l'année 166, le Langobards et l'Obii ont croisé le Danube et ont envahi Pannonia. Le Langobards a perdu la guerre, et est retourné de nouveau à leurs maisons sur le fleuve Elbe. Après ce temps, le Langobards semblent disparaître de l'histoire. Une raison est que le Langobards pourrait avoir fouillé plus profond dans les terres germaniques. Tandis qu'un certain Langobard émigrait, d'autres ont été absorbés par le Saxons environnant. Peu de temps après, le Langobards s'est levé vers le haut contre le Saxons avec leur Roi Agelmund. Le Langobards a commencé sur une autre migration. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le croisement dans Mauringa était difficile parce que l'Usipetes a nié le passage de Langobards. Pour cette raison, un combat a été arrangé entre les hommes les plus forts de chaque tribu. Le Langobards a laissé le combat comme vainqueurs, et leur passage a été accordé. Par Langobards le Mauringa atteint, et le premier roi, Agelmund, régné pendant trente années. Le Langobards est alors parti de Mauringa et est arrivé chez Golanda. Le Golanda était une terre sur la banque de l'Oder. Laissant Golanda, le Langobards a traversé Anthaib et Banthaib jusqu'à ce qu'ils aient enfin atteint Vurgundaib. Les huns ont attaqué le Langobards, et ont tué leur Roi Agelmund. Le Langobards s'est levé vers le haut contre les huns sous le nouveau Roi Laimicho. [PARAGRAPH : 1] En l'année 560, un nouveau roi a émergé qui marquerait un tournant en histoire de Langobard, Alboin. Alboin a défait le Gepids, leur a fait ses sujets et a mené le Langobards et une fédération d'autres tribus à travers les Alpes de Julian pour envahir l'Italie. La première ville importante à tomber était un forum Iulii, dans lequel il a créé le premier duché de Langobard. Son neveu, Gisulph, devait être le duc. En été de 569, le Langobards a conquis Milan, qui était alors en état terrible en raison des guerres gothiques. Pavie est tombé sous le siège après trois ans, devenant le premier capital du nouveau royaume de Langobard. En années prochaines, le Langobards a établi encore deux sud, Spoleto et Bénévent de duchés. Le Byzantines est parvenu à garder la main de Ravenne et de Rome. [PARAGRAPH : 1] Le territoire de Langobard a été divisé en 36 duchés. Le roi a régné au-dessus de eux et a administré la terre par des représentants appelés le gastaldi. Cette unité était cependant faible, et le Langobards a perdu le contrôle de Spoleto et Bénévent au temps fini de contreseings. Les décès d'Alboin et de son fils Cleph ont eu comme conséquence un interregnum de dix ans connu sous le nom de « règle des ducs ». Les ducs, menacés par les contreseings, ont élu le fils de Cleph, Authari, leur prochain roi. Authari a essayé de réorganiser l'administration royale, et parvient à finir l'alliance dangereuse entre le Byzantines et les contreseings. Après la mort d'Authari dans 590, Agilulf, duc de Turin, a régné. Il a avec succès combattu les rebelles d'Italie nordique et a conquis Padoue et Mantua.
