TEXT.English: [TAB]Throughout Late Antiquity, many distinct ethnic groups occupied the regions of what is now Poland. Many Slavic, Celtic, Baltic, and Germanic tribes were among the prominent groups. The most famous archeological find from the prehistory of Poland is the Biskupin fortified settlement. The fort has been dated to the early Iron Age, when the Lusatian culture occupied the area around 700 BC. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Poland began to take the form of a unified country around the middle of the tenth century under the Piast dynasty. Catholic Christianity was the nation's first official religion. In the twelfth century, Poland split into several smaller states. Under the Jagiellon dynasty, Poland forged an alliance with its neighbor, the Grand Duchy of Lithuania. Polish economy, military, and culture flourished in Poland-Lithuania and under the Jagiellons. Poland was famous for its tolerance for all religions, and thus became a center for the migration of the Jewish people. [PARAGRAPH: 2] A golden age resulted in the country from the newly established Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. The nobility of Poland, which were more abundant than in other Western European countries, took pleasure in the parliamentary system. During its Golden Age, Poland expanded its borders to become the largest country in Europe. However, in the middle of the seventeenth century, a Swedish invasion and Cossack's Chmielnicki Uprising marked the end of its golden age. Wars against Russia also marked the country's decline. The reforms, specifically the Great Sejm, the second modern constitution of the world, were dissatisfied with the three partitions of Poland, which began Poland's being removed from the map and its territories being divided among Russia, Prussia, and Austria. [PARAGRAPH: 2] The Poles would resent their fate and would rebel several times against the partitioners. In 1807, Napoleon created the Duchy of Warsaw, but after the Napoleonic wars, Poland was divided again. The Russian Czars who ruled the country eventually reduced the Polish freedoms, and Russia captured the country. After the invasions of Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union in 1939, Poland was split under Germany and the Soviet Union. Poland lost much of its citizens in the war, six million and at least half Polish Jews. After the borders were shifted following World War II, many people of Poland were forced to migrate. [PARAGRAPH: 2] The Soviet Union introduced a new Communist government in Poland. The People's Republic of Poland was officially proclaimed in 1952. However, in 1956, people received more freedoms and were freed from prisons after Poland became more liberal. In 1980, an independent trade union overcame the Communist Party and bared the collapse of communism across Eastern Europe. Following these changes, Poland made numerous improvements in human rights. In May 1, 2004, Poland became a full member of the European Union.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Tout au long de la fin de l'Antiquité, de nombreux groupes ethniques distincts occupé les régions de ce qui est maintenant la Pologne. Beaucoup slaves, celtiques, baltes, et les tribus germaniques ont été parmi les éminents groupes. La plus célèbre site archéologique de trouver la préhistoire de la Pologne est le Biskupin fortifié. Le fort a été à la date du début de l'âge du fer, lorsque la culture de Lusace occupé la zone autour de 700 avant notre ère. [PARAGRAPH: 2] La Pologne a commencé à prendre la forme d'un pays unifié dans le milieu du Xe siècle sous la dynastie des Piast. Le christianisme catholique a été le premier religion officielle. Au XIIe siècle, la Pologne divisée en plusieurs petits Etats. Sous la dynastie des Jagellon, Pologne forgé une alliance avec son voisin, le Grand Duché de Lituanie. Économie polonaise, militaires, et de la culture florissante en Pologne, en Lituanie et en vertu de la Jagiellons. La Pologne est connue pour sa tolérance envers toutes les religions, et est ainsi devenu un centre pour la migration du peuple juif. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Un âge d'or a entraîné dans le pays de la nouvellement créée polonais-lituanien. La noblesse de la Pologne, qui ont été plus abondantes que dans les autres pays d'Europe occidentale, a pris plaisir dans le système parlementaire. Au cours de son âge d'or, de la Pologne a élargi ses frontières pour devenir le plus grand pays d'Europe. Toutefois, dans le milieu du XVIIe siècle, un suédois invasion et de Chmielnicki soulèvement cosaque a marqué la fin de son âge d'or. Guerres contre la Russie a également marqué le déclin du pays. Les réformes, en particulier de la Grande-Bretagne Sejm, la deuxième constitution moderne du monde, n'étaient pas satisfaits avec les trois partitions de la Pologne, qui a mis fin à la Pologne est retirée de la carte et de son territoire étant partagé entre la Russie, la Prusse et l'Autriche. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Les Polonais ressentent leur sort et se rebelle à plusieurs reprises contre le partitioners. En 1807, Napoléon a créé le Duché de Varsovie, mais après les guerres napoléoniennes, la Pologne est à nouveau divisé. Les tsars russes qui ont gouverné le pays finalement réduit le polonais libertés, et de la Russie capturé le pays. Après l'invasion de l'Allemagne nazie et l'Union soviétique en 1939, la Pologne a été scindée en vertu de l'Allemagne et de l'Union soviétique. La Pologne a perdu beaucoup de ses citoyens dans la guerre, six millions et au moins la moitié de juifs polonais. Après les frontières ont été déplacés après la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, de nombreuses personnes de la Pologne ont été forcés d'émigrer. [PARAGRAPHE: 2] L'Union soviétique a présenté un nouveau gouvernement communiste en Pologne. La République populaire de Pologne a été officiellement proclamée en 1952. Toutefois, en 1956, la population a reçu plus de libertés et ont été libérés de prison après la Pologne est devenue plus libérale. En 1980, un syndicat indépendant surmonté le Parti communiste et bared l'effondrement du communisme dans toute l'Europe de l'Est. Suite à ces changements, la Pologne a apporté de nombreuses améliorations dans les droits de l'homme. Au 1er mai 2004, la Pologne est devenue membre à part entière de l'Union européenne.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Überall in Late Antiquity, viele verschiedene ethnische Gruppen, die besetzten Gebiete von dem, was jetzt Polen. Viele slawische, keltische, Ostsee, und germanischen Stämme waren unter den prominenten Gruppen. Die berühmtesten archäologischen finden, von der Vorgeschichte der Polen ist die befestigte Siedlung Biskupin. Die Festung wurde vom bis in die frühen Eisenzeit, wenn die Lausitzer Kultur besetzten das Gebiet um 700 v. Chr.. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Polen begann, in der Form eines geeinten Landes etwa in der Mitte des zehnten Jahrhunderts unter der Piasten. Katholische Christentum wurde das Volk der ersten offiziellen Religion. In der zwölften Jahrhundert, Polen, unterteilt in mehrere kleinere Staaten. Unter der Jagiellonen, Polen gefälscht ein Bündnis mit seinen Nachbarn, das Großherzogtum Litauen. Polnischen Wirtschaft, Militär und Kultur blühten in Polen - Litauen und unter der Jagiellons. Polen war bekannt für seine Toleranz für alle Religionen, und wurde so zu einem Zentrum für die Migration des jüdischen Volkes. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Ein goldenes Zeitalter geführt, in dem Land, aus dem neu gegründeten polnisch-litauischen Commonwealth. Der Adel in Polen, die häufiger als in anderen westeuropäischen Ländern, erfreuten sich in der parlamentarischen System. Während seiner Golden Age, Polen erweitert seine Grenzen zu den größten in Europa. However, in der Mitte des siebzehnten Jahrhunderts, einem schwedischen Invasion und Kosaken's Chmielnicki Aufstands markiert das Ende seiner goldenen Zeitalter. Kriege gegen Russland auch im Land rückläufig. Die Reformen, insbesondere der Große Sejm, die zweite moderne Verfassung der Welt, unzufrieden waren mit den drei Partitionen mit Polen, das endete Polen, die beseitigt werden auf der Karte und ihre Territorien wird geteilt zwischen Russland, Preußen und Österreich. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Die Polen würden sich gegen ihr Schicksal und die Rebellen mehrere Male gegen den sichtbar. In 1807, Napoleon das Herzogtum Warschau, aber nach den napoleonischen Kriegen, Polen wurde erneut. Die russischen Zaren, die das Land schließlich reduziert die polnischen Freiheiten, und Russland erobert das Land. Nachdem die Invasionen der nationalsozialistischen Deutschland und der Sowjetunion 1939, Polen aufgeteilt wurde unter Deutschland und der Sowjetunion. Polen verlor viel von seiner Bürger in den Krieg, sechs Millionen und mindestens die Hälfte polnischen Juden. Nachdem die Grenzen verschoben wurden nach dem Zweiten Weltkrieg viele Menschen in Polen waren gezwungen zu migrieren. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Die Sowjetunion eine neue kommunistische Regierung in Polen. Der Volksrepublik Polen wurde offiziell verkündet im 1952. However, in der 1956 Menschen mehr Freiheiten und freigelassen wurden aus den Gefängnissen nach Polen wurde liberaler. In 1980, eine unabhängige Gewerkschaft gegen die Kommunistische Partei und entblößte dem Zusammenbruch des Kommunismus in Osteuropa. Nach diesen Änderungen, Polen, die zahlreiche Verbesserungen im Bereich der Menschenrechte. Im Mai 1, 2004, wurde Polen ein vollwertiges Mitglied der Europäischen Union.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Tutta Tarda Antichità, molti gruppi etnici distinti occupato le regioni di quella che è oggi la Polonia. Molti slavo, celtica, Mar Baltico, e tribù germaniche sono stati tra i gruppi di spicco. Il più famoso reperti dalla preistoria della Polonia è il Biskupin insediamento fortificato. Il forte è stata datata agli inizi età del ferro, quando la Lusatian cultura occupato l'area attorno 700 aC. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Polonia ha cominciato a prendere la forma di un unico paese, verso la metà del decimo secolo, sotto la dinastia Piast. Cattolica, il cristianesimo è stato il primo paese della religione ufficiale. Nel XII secolo, la Polonia suddivisi in diversi Stati più piccoli. Sotto la dinastia Jagellone, Polonia forgiato un'alleanza con il suo prossimo, il Granducato di Lituania. Economia polacca, militari, e la cultura fiorita in Polonia - Lituania e sotto la Jagiellons. La Polonia è stata famosa per la sua tolleranza per tutte le religioni, e, quindi, è diventato un centro per la migrazione del popolo ebraico. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Un epoca d'oro portato nel paese dal neoistituito Polacco-Lituano. La nobiltà di Polonia, che sono state più abbondanti che in altri paesi dell'Europa occidentale, ha avuto piacere nel sistema parlamentare. Nel corso della sua Golden Age, Polonia ampliato i suoi confini a diventare il più grande paese in Europa. Tuttavia, a metà del XVII secolo, una invasione svedese cosacco e di Chmielnicki Uprising segnato la fine della sua epoca d'oro. Guerre contro la Russia ha anche segnato il declino del paese. Le riforme, in particolare la Gran Sejm, la seconda moderna costituzione del mondo, non sono soddisfatti con le tre partizioni di Polonia, che si è conclusa la Polonia viene rimosso dalla mappa e il suo territorio è diviso tra la Russia, Prussia e Austria. [PARAGRAPH: 2] I polacchi sarebbe di nuovo il loro destino e ribelli avrebbero più volte contro il partitioners. Nel 1807, Napoleone creò il ducato di Varsavia, ma dopo le guerre napoleoniche, la Polonia è stata divisa. Zar russo, che ha governato il paese eventualmente ridotto il polacco libertà, e la Russia catturato il paese. Dopo l'invasione nazista della Germania e dell'Unione Sovietica nel 1939, la Polonia è stato diviso sotto la Germania e l'Unione Sovietica. Polonia perso gran parte dei suoi cittadini, in guerra, sei milioni di euro e almeno la metà ebrei polacchi. Dopo le frontiere sono state spostate dopo la seconda guerra mondiale, molte persone della Polonia sono stati costretti a migrare. [PARAGRAPH: 2] L'Unione Sovietica ha introdotto un nuovo governo comunista in Polonia. La Repubblica popolare di Polonia è stata ufficialmente proclamata nel 1952. Tuttavia, nel 1956, ha ricevuto più persone e la libertà sono stati liberati dalle carceri, dopo la Polonia è diventata più liberale. Nel 1980, un sindacato indipendente ha vinto il partito comunista e si scoprì il crollo del comunismo in tutta l'Europa orientale. A seguito di queste modifiche, la Polonia effettuati numerosi miglioramenti in materia di diritti umani. Nel 1 ° maggio 2004, la Polonia è diventata membro a pieno titolo dell'Unione europea.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Durante todo Antigüedad tardía, muchos grupos étnicos de las regiones ocupadas de lo que hoy es Polonia. Muchos eslavos, celtas, Báltico, y las tribus germánicas fueron algunos de los prominentes grupos. El más famoso de encontrar arqueológico de la prehistoria de Polonia es el Biskupin asentamiento fortificado. La fortaleza ha sido la fecha a principios de la Edad de Hierro, cuando la cultura lusaciana ocupó el área alrededor de 700 adC. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Polonia comenzó a tomar la forma de un país unificado alrededor de la mitad del siglo X bajo la dinastía Piast. El cristianismo católico era la nación la primera religión oficial. En el siglo XII, Polonia dividida en varios pequeños estados. En virtud de la Jagiellon dinastía, Polonia forjado una alianza con su vecino, el Gran Ducado de Lituania. Economía polaca, militar, y la cultura floreció en Polonia - Lituania, y en virtud de la Jagiellons. Polonia fue famoso por su tolerancia de todas las religiones, y se convirtió así en un centro de la migración del pueblo judío. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Una edad de oro en el país como resultado de la recién creada Comunidad de Polonia y Lituania. La nobleza de Polonia, que fueron más abundantes que en otros países de Europa occidental, con satisfacción, en el sistema parlamentario. Durante el Siglo de Oro, Polonia amplió sus fronteras para convertirse en el país más grande de Europa. Sin embargo, a mediados del siglo XVII, un sueco invasión y Cosacos del Chmielnicki Uprising marcó el final de su edad de oro. Las guerras contra Rusia también marcó el declive del país. Las reformas, en particular la Gran Sejm, la segunda constitución moderna del mundo, no estaban satisfechos con las tres particiones de Polonia, de Polonia, que terminó siendo eliminado del mapa y sus territorios está dividido entre Rusia, Prusia y Austria. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Los polacos se resienten de su suerte y los rebeldes en varias ocasiones por la partitioners. En 1807, Napoleón creó el Ducado de Varsovia, pero después de las guerras napoleónicas, Polonia fue dividida de nuevo. Los zares de Rusia, que gobernó el país eventualmente reducido el polaco libertades, y Rusia capturó el país. Después de la invasión de la Alemania nazi y la Unión Soviética en 1939, Polonia fue dividida en virtud de Alemania y la Unión Soviética. Polonia perdió gran parte de sus ciudadanos en la guerra, seis millones y por lo menos la mitad polaco Judios. Después de las fronteras se cambiaban después de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, muchos de los polacos se vieron obligados a emigrar. [PARAGRAPH: 2] La Unión Soviética introdujo un nuevo gobierno comunista en Polonia. La República Popular de Polonia fue proclamada oficialmente en 1952. Sin embargo, en 1956, la población recibió más libertades y fueron liberados de las cárceles después de Polonia se convirtió más liberal. En 1980, un sindicato independiente venció el Partido Comunista y bared el colapso del comunismo en Europa oriental. A raíz de estos cambios, Polonia hizo numerosas mejoras en los derechos humanos. En el 1 de mayo de 2004, Polonia se convirtió en miembro de pleno derecho de la Unión Europea.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Polynesia comprises of the island groups of Samoa, the Cook Islands, French Polynesia, and Niue, the islands of Tokelau, Tuvalu, Tonga, Wallis, Futuna, Hawaii, and Pitcairn Island. The original inhabitants of New Zealand, the Maori, are also considered Polynesian. The island of Fiji is sometimes included in Polynesia because of its high percentage of Polynesian inhabitants. Archaeological evidence supports that Polynesia was settled by migration from Melanesia beginning about 3,000 to 4,000 years ago. The Samoans are believed to have settled the Marquesas perhaps as early as 300 AD, and Easter Island may have been settled from the Marquesas as early as 400 AD. Hawaii was also settled by these voyagers during the second half of the first millennium AD, and then the Society Islanders, who were the point of origin for the Polynesians who settled on Cook Island. Around 1000 AD, these cultures also inhabited Polynesia. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Prior to European contact, Polynesian settlements were either in hamlets or villages. Houses were clustered in small groups, and villages contained 30 or more houses. These villages were primarily found on the islands of Samoa and New Zealand and were often fortified by walls of stone or wooden palisades. Both of these types of settlements relied on family oriented organization. The most common type of organization was that power passed from the first born son to firstborn son and so on. In Polynesian societies, chiefs would be revered as equals to others. However, they could usually trace their family line back to the creator gods. In societies where the chief was protected and separate from the people, warfare was common. Christian missionaries succeeded in overthrowing ancient religious practices only after they had converted the chiefs. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Religion and magic played an important role in Polynesian culture. Each of the gods had their own rituals, which were carried out by the priests. Among these practices were sacrifice, chanting, feasting, and fertility rites. Magic was also enveloping, and countless rituals regarding love, war, revenge, agriculture, and fishing were practiced. Polynesian culture was a largely marine based. In addition to fish, mollusks and crustaceans were an important source of food. Fishing was usually a group activity, and Polynesian fishermen explored the vast expanses of ocean around their homes. Other food could be provided by various plants. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Food plants also provided materials for various reasons. Breadfruit wood was used in canoe making, for instance, and leaves of some plants were used in weaving mats, clothing, sails, and other household goods. Both single and double canoes were equipped with mat sails. Some boats were large enough to transport families, domesticated animals, and plants over long stretches of ocean. Over time, cultures developed distinct artistic skills. Ruined stone temples can be found in the Society Islands, Easter Island, and the Marquesas culture. Good such as canoes, war clubs, shields, and fish hooks were elaborately decorated. Feather cloaks showed an enormous amount of effort in gathering rare feathers and arranging them in intricate designs. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Contact with European culture began in the late 1700s and radically changed Polynesia. Spanish explorers were eager to search for riches and spread Christianity. The Dutch and British also explored areas such as New Zealand and the Samoan islands. Resistance to European intervention occurred in almost all of the Polynesian islands, but such movements were brief. For much time to come, Polynesia would go under the power of European powers and the United States. Polynesian culture, however, always remained in these islands.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Polynésie est composée de groupes de l'île de Samoa, les îles Cook, la Polynésie française, et Niue, les îles de Tokelau, Tuvalu, Tonga, Wallis, Futuna, à Hawaii, et l'île de Pitcairn. Les premiers habitants de la Nouvelle-Zélande, les Maoris, les Polynésiens sont également considérés. L'île des Fidji est parfois inclus dans la Polynésie en raison de son fort pourcentage d'habitants polynésiens. Témoignages archéologiques soutient que la Polynésie a été réglée par la migration à partir de début Mélanésie environ 3.000 à 4.000 ans. Les Samoans sont soupçonnés d'avoir réglé les Marquises peut-être dès 300 après J.-C., et l'île de Pâques ont pu être réglées depuis les Marquises dès 400 après Jésus Christ. Hawaii a aussi été réglé par les voyageurs au cours de la seconde moitié du premier millénaire après JC, puis la Société Islanders, qui ont été le point d'origine de l'Polynésiens qui se sont installés sur des îles Cook. Environ 1000 AD, ces cultures aussi habitée Polynésie. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Avant le contact avec les Européens, les Polynésiens colonies étaient soit en hameaux ou villages. Des maisons ont été regroupés en petits groupes, et les villages contient 30 ou plusieurs maisons. Ces villages ont été trouvés principalement sur les îles Samoa et la Nouvelle-Zélande, et sont souvent enrichis par des murs de pierre ou de bois palissades. Ces deux types d'établissements invoqué organisation familiale. Le type le plus courant de l'organisation était que le pouvoir est passé depuis le premier fils né à fils premier-né et ainsi de suite. Dans les sociétés polynésiennes, les chefs serait considéré comme égal aux autres. Toutefois, ils pourraient retrouver leur famille généralement retour à la ligne créateur dieux. Dans les sociétés où le chef était protégé et à l'écart de la population, la guerre était commun. Missionnaires chrétiens ont réussi à renverser les anciennes pratiques religieuses uniquement après avoir converti les chefs. [PARAGRAPH: 2] La religion et la magie jouent un rôle important dans la culture polynésienne. Chacun des dieux avaient leurs propres rites, qui ont été perpétrés par des prêtres. Parmi ces pratiques sont le sacrifice, le chant, de fête, de rites et de la fertilité. Magic était aussi enveloppant, et d'innombrables rituels concernant l'amour, la guerre, la vengeance, l'agriculture et la pêche ont été pratiquées. Culture polynésienne était largement fondée marines. En plus des poissons, mollusques et crustacés ont été une source importante de nourriture. La pêche est souvent une activité de groupe, et les pêcheurs polynésiens ont exploré les vastes étendues de l'océan autour de leur maison. Autres produits alimentaires pourraient être fournies par diverses plantes. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Food plantes a également fourni du matériel pour des raisons diverses. Breadfruit bois a été utilisé en canot rendant, par exemple, et les feuilles de certaines plantes ont été utilisés dans le tissage de tapis, les vêtements, voiles, et d'autres biens d'équipement ménager. Les deux simples et doubles canots étaient équipés d'un tapis de voiles. Certains bateaux ont été assez grands pour le transport des familles, les animaux domestiques et les plantes sur de grandes étendues de l'océan. Au fil du temps, développé des cultures distinctes compétences artistiques. Les temples en pierre en ruine peut être trouvée dans les Îles de la Société, l'île de Pâques, les Marquises et de la culture. Bon tels que canots, de la guerre des clubs, des boucliers et des hameçons ont été minutieusement décorés. Plume mantos montré une énorme quantité d'efforts pour recueillir des rares plumes et arrangeant dans les modèles complexes. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Le contact avec la culture européenne a commencé à la fin des années 1700 et radicalement changé la Polynésie. Explorateurs espagnols étaient impatients de recherche de la richesse et à la propagation du christianisme. Le néerlandais et britannique a également étudié des domaines tels que la Nouvelle-Zélande et les îles des Samoa. Résistance à l'intervention européenne a eu lieu dans presque toutes les îles polynésiennes, mais ces mouvements ont été brève. Pour beaucoup de temps à venir, la Polynésie se retrouvera dans le pouvoir des puissances européennes et des États-Unis. Culture polynésienne, cependant, toujours restés dans ces îles.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Polynesien besteht aus Gruppen von der Insel Samoa, die Cook Inseln, Französisch Polynesien, Niue, die Inseln Tokelau, Tuvalu, Tonga, Wallis, Futuna, Hawaii, und Pitcairn Island. Die Ureinwohner Neuseelands, die Maori, sind ebenfalls als polynesischen. Die Insel Fidschi ist manchmal in Polynesien wegen seiner hohen Anteil der polynesischen Einwohner. Archäologische Belege, dass Polynesien wurde von Migration von Melanesien ab etwa 3.000 bis 4.000 Jahren. Die Samoaner sind der Ansicht, dass sich die Marquesas vielleicht so früh wie 300 n. Chr., und Osterinsel Mai geklärt sind von den Marquesas so früh wie 400 n.Chr. Hawaii war auch durch diese Reisenden in der zweiten Hälfte des ersten Jahrtausends n. Chr., und dann der Gesellschaft Islanders, die als Ausgangspunkt für die Polynesier, die sich auf Cook Island. Um 1000 n. Chr., diese Kulturen auch bewohnt Polynesien. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Vor dem Europäischen Kontakt, polynesische Siedlungen wurden entweder in Weiler oder Dörfer. Die Häuser wurden gebündelt in kleinen Gruppen, und Dörfer mit 30 oder mehr Wohnungen. Diese Dörfer waren vor allem auf den Inseln von Samoa und Neuseeland und waren oft von befestigten Mauern aus Stein oder hölzernen Palisaden. Beide Arten von Siedlungen auf Familie ausgerichtete Organisation. Die häufigste Art der Organisation war, dass die Macht vom ersten Sohn geboren Erstgeborenen Sohn, und so weiter. In polynesischen Gesellschaften, Häuptlinge wäre verehrt und gleichberechtigt mit anderen. Allerdings könnten sie meist den Spuren ihrer Familie zurück in die Zeile Schöpfer Götter. In Gesellschaften, in denen der Chef war geschützt und getrennt von den Menschen, Kriegsführung war häufig. Christlichen Missionaren gelang es den Sturz alten religiösen Praktiken nur, nachdem sie konvertiert war die Chefs. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Religion und Magie spielte eine wichtige Rolle in der polynesischen Kultur. Jeder der Götter hatten ihre eigenen Rituale, die durchgeführt wurden, indem die Priester. Zu diesen Praktiken waren Opfer, Deklamieren, Schlemmen, Riten und Fruchtbarkeit. Magie war auch Kuvertierung, und zahllose Rituale über Liebe, Krieg, Rache, Landwirtschaft und Fischerei wurden geübt. Polynesischen Kultur war ein weitgehend marinen beruht. Zusätzlich zu Fisch, Muscheln und Krebse waren eine wichtige Quelle von Lebensmitteln. Angeln in der Regel eine Gruppe, und polynesische Fischer erkundet die große Weiten des Ozeans rund um ihr Zuhause. Andere Lebensmittel werden könnten, die von verschiedenen Pflanzen. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Essen Pflanzen auch Materialien für die verschiedenen Gründen. Brotfruchtbaum Holz verwendet wurde im Kanu machen, zum Beispiel, und einige Blätter von Pflanzen wurden in die Weberei Matten, Bekleidung, Segel, und andere Haushaltsgeräte. Sowohl Einzel- und Doppelzimmer Kanus wurden mit Matte Segel. Einige Boote waren groß genug, um Verkehr Familien, domestizierten Tiere und Pflanzen über weite Strecken des Ozeans. Im Laufe der Zeit entwickelte Kulturen unterschiedliche künstlerische Fähigkeiten. Steinruine Tempel finden sich in der Gesellschaft Inseln, die Osterinsel, und die Marquesas Kultur. Gute wie Kanus, Krieg Clubs, Schilde, und Fisch Haken waren aufwendig gestaltet. Feather Mäntel zeigte eine enorme Anstrengungen bei der Erfassung seltener Federn und Vermittlung in komplexen Designs. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Kontakt mit der europäischen Kultur begann in den späten 1700er und radikal verändert Polynesien. Spanische Forscher waren eifrig bei der Suche nach Reichtum und der Verbreitung des Christentums. Die niederländischen und britischen auch erkundet Bereichen wie Neuseeland und den samoanischen Inseln. Widerstand der europäischen Intervention in fast allen der polynesischen Inseln, aber solche Bewegungen waren kurz. Für viel Zeit zu kommen, Polynesien würde unter der Macht der europäischen Mächte und die Vereinigten Staaten. Polynesische Kultur, jedoch immer noch in diesen Inseln.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Polinesia comprende l'isola di gruppi di Samoa, Isole Cook, Polinesia francese, e Niue, le isole di Tokelau, Tuvalu, Tonga, Wallis, Futuna, Hawaii, e Pitcairn Island. Gli abitanti originari della Nuova Zelanda, i Maori, anche in considerazione della Polinesia. L'isola delle Figi è talvolta inclusi nella Polinesia a causa della sua elevata percentuale di abitanti della Polinesia. Archeologico prove sostiene che la Polinesia è stata regolata dalla migrazione Melanesia iniziate da circa 3.000 a 4.000 anni fa. Il Samoans si ritiene di aver risolto il Marquesas forse già nel 300 dC, e Isola di Pasqua potrebbe essere stata risolta dal Marquesas già nel 400 dC. Hawaii è stata risolta anche da questi viaggiatori durante la seconda metà del primo millennio dC, e poi la società Islanders, che sono stati il punto di origine per i Polinesiani che insediati sul Cook Island. Intorno al 1000 dC, queste culture anche abitato Polinesia. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Prima di contatto europeo, polinesiani erano insediamenti o in frazioni o villaggi. Case sono state raggruppate in piccoli gruppi, e villaggi conteneva 30 o più case. Questi villaggi sono stati trovati soprattutto sulle isole di Samoa e la Nuova Zelanda e sono stati spesso fortificato da mura di pietra o di legno palizzate. Entrambi questi tipi di insediamenti valere famiglia orientata organizzazione. Il tipo più comune di organizzazione di potere che è stato superato dal primo figlio a figlio primogenito, e così via. In Polinesia società, capi sarebbe riverito come uguale agli altri. Tuttavia, di solito si potrebbe risalire la loro famiglia torna alla linea il creatore dei. Nelle società in cui il capo è stato protetto e separato dal popolo, la guerra è stata comune. Missionari cristiani sono riusciti a rovesciare antiche pratiche religiose solo dopo aver convertito capi. [PARAGRAPH: 2] religione e la magia svolto un ruolo importante nella cultura polinesiana. Ciascuno di loro ha avuto dei propri rituali, che sono stati effettuati dai sacerdoti. Tra queste pratiche erano sacrificio, canto, festa, e di riti di fertilità. Magic è stato anche avvolgente, e innumerevoli rituali per quanto riguarda l'amore, la guerra, la vendetta, l'agricoltura, la pesca e sono state praticate. Polinesia cultura è stato un gran marini fonda. Oltre a pesci, molluschi e crostacei sono state un'importante fonte di cibo. La pesca è stata generalmente di un gruppo di attività, e la Polinesia pescatori esplorato il vasto oceano intorno distese di loro case. Altri alimenti possono essere forniti da varie piante. [PARAGRAPH: 2] alimentare impianti anche fornito materiali per vari motivi. Pane di legno è stato usato in canoa fare, per esempio, e le foglie di alcuni impianti sono stati utilizzati in tessitura tappeti, vestiti, vele, e di altri beni. Entrambe le singole e doppie canoe erano equipaggiate con vele tappetino. Alcune imbarcazioni sono state abbastanza grande per il trasporto di famiglie, animali addomesticati, e di impianti per lunghi tratti di mare. Nel corso del tempo, di culture distinte sviluppato capacità artistiche. Rovinato pietra templi si trovano nella Società Isole, Isola di Pasqua, e la cultura Marquesas. Buona come canoe, club di guerra, scudi, e di pesce ganci erano elaboratamente decorato. Piume cloaks mostrato un enorme sforzo nella raccolta di rari piume e organizzare in intricati disegni. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Il contatto con la cultura europea ha avuto inizio alla fine del 1700 e ha cambiato radicalmente la Polinesia. Esploratori spagnoli erano desiderosi di ricerca per la ricchezza e la diffusione del cristianesimo. Gli olandesi e britannici anche esplorare settori come la Nuova Zelanda e le isole Samoa. Resistenza agli europei intervento è avvenuto in quasi tutte le isole della Polinesia, ma tali movimenti sono stati brevi. Per molto tempo a venire, Polinesia andrebbe sotto il potere di potenze europee e gli Stati Uniti. Polinesia cultura, tuttavia, è rimasta sempre in queste isole.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Polinesia comprende grupos de la isla de Samoa, las Islas Cook, la Polinesia Francesa, y Niue, las Islas de Tokelau, Tuvalu, Tonga, Wallis y Futuna, Hawaii, y la isla de Pitcairn. Los habitantes originarios de Nueva Zelanda, los maoríes, también se consideran de Polinesia. La isla de Fiji veces se incluyen en la Polinesia, debido a su alto porcentaje de habitantes polinesios. Archaeological pruebas apoyan que la Polinesia fue resuelta por la migración de Melanesia inicio unos 3.000 a 4.000 años atrás. Los samoanos se cree que se han asentado las Marquesas quizás ya en 300 dC, y la Isla de Pascua puede haber sido resuelta de las Marquesas ya en 400 DC. Hawaii fue también reiterada por esas viaje durante la segunda mitad del primer milenio dC, y luego la Sociedad de los isleños, que fueron el punto de origen de los polinesios que se establecieron en las Islas Cook. Alrededor de 1000 DC, estas culturas también habitada Polinesia. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Antes del contacto europeo, de Polinesia fueron los asentamientos, ya sea en aldeas o caseríos. Casas se agruparon en grupos pequeños, y los pueblos que figuran 30 o más viviendas. Estas aldeas se encuentran principalmente en las islas de Samoa y Nueva Zelandia y son a menudo fortificadas por muros de piedra o empalizadas de madera. Ambos de estos tipos de asentamientos se basó en la organización orientada a la familia. El tipo más común de organización es que el poder pasa de la primera a hijo nacido hijo primogénito, etc. En las sociedades de Polinesia, jefes sería venerado como iguales a los demás. Sin embargo, por lo general pueden localizar a sus familiares de nuevo a la línea de dioses creadores. En las sociedades en que el jefe estaba protegida y separada del pueblo, la guerra era común. Misioneros cristianos tenido éxito en derrocar a antiguas prácticas religiosas sólo después de que se habían convertido los jefes. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Religión y magia desempeñado un papel importante en la cultura polinesia. Cada uno de los dioses tienen sus propios rituales, que fueron llevados a cabo por los sacerdotes. Entre estas prácticas se sacrificio, cantando, banquete, y los ritos de la fertilidad. Magic también fue envolviendo, y un sinnúmero de rituales en relación con el amor, la guerra, la venganza, la agricultura y la pesca se practica. Cultura polinesia era un gran marino basada. Además de los peces, moluscos y crustáceos son una fuente importante de alimento. La pesca es generalmente una actividad de grupo, y los pescadores polinesios explorar vastas extensiones de los océanos alrededor de sus hogares. Otros alimentos podría ser proporcionada por diversas plantas. [PARAGRAPH: 2] Alimentación plantas también proporcionó materiales por diversas razones. Pan madera se utiliza en la canoa, por ejemplo, y las hojas de algunas plantas se han utilizado en el tejido de alfombras, ropa, velas, y otros artículos para el hogar. Las dos canoas individuales y dobles equipadas con colchoneta velas. Algunos barcos eran lo suficientemente grandes como para el transporte de las familias, los animales domesticados, plantas y más largas extensiones de océano. Con el tiempo, las culturas desarrolladas aptitudes artísticas distintas. Templos de piedra en ruinas se pueden encontrar en la sociedad de las Islas, la Isla de Pascua, la cultura y las Marquesas. Bueno, como canoas, clubes de la guerra, escudos, y los peces se ganchos elaboradamente decorado. Feather mantos mostró una enorme cantidad de esfuerzo en la recopilación y organización de plumas raras en intrincados diseños. [PARAGRAPH: 2] contacto con la cultura europea comenzó a fines de 1700 y cambió radicalmente la Polinesia. Exploradores españoles que estaban deseosos de búsqueda de la riqueza y difundir el cristianismo. Los holandeses y británicos también se exploraron áreas tales como Nueva Zelanda y las islas de Samoa. La resistencia a la intervención europea se produjo en casi todas las islas de la Polinesia, pero esos movimientos fueron breves. Por mucho tiempo, la Polinesia iría bajo el poder de las potencias europeas y los Estados Unidos. Cultura polinesia, sin embargo, siempre se mantuvo en esas islas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Romanians trace their history back to 300 B.C. But Romania did not become an independent, unified country until 1861. During most of the time in-between, various foreign peoples ruled all or part of Romania.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the years from 300 to 200 B.C., Dacian people farmed, mined gold and iron ore, and traded with neighboring peoples. Romania was called "Dacia" during this period. The Romans, under Emperor Trajan, conquered Dacia in A.D. 106, and made it a province of the Roman Empire. Roman soldiers occupied Dacia, and Roman colonists settled there. The Romans intermarried with the Dacians, who adopted Roman customs and the Latin language. Dacia became known as Romania because of the Roman occupation and influence.[PARAGRAPH:2]Barbarians from the east and north began invading Romania during the 2nd century A.D. They forced the Romans to abandon the province in the late 200's. The invasions were to continue off and on until the 1100's. The invaders included Bulgars, Goths, Huns, Magyars, Slavs, and Tartars. These groups, especially the Slavs, intermarried with the Romanians.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Romanian nobles made several attempts to gain freedom from the Ottoman Empire. As a result, in the early 1700s, the empire sent wealthy Greeks to govern the principalities. These Greeks were called Phanariots because they came from the Phanar district of Constantinople (now Istanbul, Turkey). They taxed the peasants far more than ever before and treated them harshly. Phanariot rule lasted until 1821, when a revolt by Romanians forced the Ottomans to remove the Greeks from power. Many scholars believe that Romania's peasants never suffered more than they did during the Phanariot period.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Russians took over next. During the late 1700s, the Ottoman Empire suffered a series of military defeats at the hands of Russia. Little by little, the Ottomans lost parts of their empire. Officially, Ottoman rule of the principalities lasted until 1878. But, in effect, it ended in 1829, when Russian troops occupied the principalities. Russia drew up a constitution for the principalities in the early 1830s. The constitution, called "Organic Statutes," gave governing power in each principality to an assembly of nobles. This marked the beginning of representative government in Romania. Russia's troops withdrew from the principalities in 1834. The idea of uniting Moldavia and Walachia existed almost from the time the principalities were founded. The unification movement grew rapidly during the mid-1800s. In 1859, the assemblies of the two principalities elected Prince Alexander John Cuza as their common ruler. In 1861, the principalities officially united to form a nation called Romania. In 1878, the major nations of Europe officially recognized Romania's full independence from Turkey. In 1881, Romania became a kingdom, and Carol became King Carol I.[PARAGRAPH:2]At the start of Carol's reign, Romania's first political parties were established, and the people were given the right to elect their government representatives. But a complex election system kept the peasants from having many representatives. Romania's economy improved under Carol. Wealthy Romanians benefited from the economic growth, but the peasants gained little from it. In 1907, Romania's peasants revolted. They burned the houses and destroyed the crops of many wealthy landowners. The Romanian Army put down the revolt, killing at least 10,000 peasants. Carol died in 1914, and his nephew Ferdinand became king.[PARAGRAPH:2]World War I was fought from 1914 to 1918. Romania remained neutral at first. But in 1916, it joined France, Great Britain, and the other Allies in their fight against the Central Powers (chiefly Austria-Hungary and Germany). Romania wanted to gain Banat, Bukovina, and Transylvania--three provinces of Austria-Hungary that had large Romanian populations. The Allies won the war, and Romania received the territories it wanted as part of the peace settlement. As a result, Romania about doubled in size and population. For the first time, Romania's territory included almost all the land where large numbers of Romanians lived.[PARAGRAPH:2]World War II ended in 1945, and the Allies took northern Transylvania from Hungary and returned it to Romania. The Soviet Union and Bulgaria kept the Romanian territory they had taken. The Communists declared Romania an "independent people's democracy." But Romania was a Soviet satellite (country controlled by the Soviet Union). In 1948 and 1952, Romania adopted constitutions that praised the Soviet Union. Romania's government, educational system, and other institutions were modeled on those of the Soviet Union. Soviet leaders directed Romania's economy and forced the country to emphasize agriculture and neglect industry. They also set foreign policy.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ceausescu's government maintained an extensive system of restrictions on the lives of the people. In mid-December 1989, thousands of people in the city of Timisoara staged demonstrations, calling for greater freedom from the Communist government and for an improved standard of living. Government security forces responded to the protests by firing on the people and killing hundreds. Antigovernment protests then spread across Romania. In Bucharest, tens of thousands gathered in the streets and called for increased freedoms and the resignation of Ceausescu. Security forces fired on the crowds, bringing the death toll of demonstrators into the thousands. Army units joined the revolt, and fierce fighting between the army and Ceausescu's security forces followed.[PARAGRAPH:2]On December 22, Ceausescu and his wife, Elena, fled Bucharest during a massive antigovernment demonstration. However, they were soon captured by the army. A secret trial took place and Ceausescu and his wife were charged with murder and embezzlement of government funds. They were found guilty and were executed on December 25. [PARAGRAPH:2]Much discussion is currently focused on the decision by Romania's government to join the European Union (EU).

[TAB]The earliest settlement in Scotland may date from as early as 4000 B.C. Many large structures remain from the later part of the New Stone Age. The Romans attempted to suppress the militaristic northern tribes. Eventually, they withdrew south of Hadrian's Wall, which they completed in the year 128 across northern England. The Picts and Scots, along the Britons, Angles, and the Vikings, all contributed to the establishment of a Scottish kingdom by the 10th and 11th centuries. [PARAGRAPH: 1] The early years of Scotland's kingdom was characterized by violence. Shakespeare's "Macbeth" is an example. In the story, the Scottish king Duncan I is killed by his general Macbeth and his son, Malcolm III, succeeds to the throne. The 13th century was more peaceful. However, in 1290, Scottish lords fought over the succession to the throne. England's King Edward tried but failed to install a king into the Scottish throne. He then invaded Scotland and declared himself overlord. The Scots rose against Edward I under the leadership of a great hero, Sir William Wallace. After Wallace's execution, the revolt continued under the leadership of Robert the Bruce, the leading candidate for the throne. He was crowned King Robert I in 1306. He defeated the English at Bannockburn in 1314, and in 1328, the English signed a treaty recognizing Scotland's independence. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Robert's son David II died childless. Several nobles struggled for the throne, and the Stuart noble family won. Robert II, the first Stuart king, was crowned in 1371. A later Stuart king, James I, and his son James II strengthened the central government. During this time, trade flourished and universities were founded. Scotland was usually allied with France against England during these years. In 1502, James IV tried to strengthen Scotland's ties with England by marrying Margaret Tudor. Margaret was the daughter of King Henry VII. But conflicts between James and Henry VIII led to border war. James was killed at the Battle of Flodden Field in 1513 and was succeeded by his son, James V. [PARAGRAPH: 1] One of Scotland's most famous rulers, Mary, Queen of Scots, James V's daughter, ruled at this time. She was the last monarch of a separate Scottish kingdom. In 1603 her son James VI succeeded to the throne of England and Ireland as James I. With the Act of Union in 1707, England, Ireland, and Scotland were united under one parliament and ruler. Wales was already under English rule at this time. Meanwhile, the Scots continued to maintain their own identity. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Ever since the Scots ceased to govern themselves, generations of Scottish nationalists have called for an independent state. More moderate people have supported devolution, which would return power over to local affairs to an elected Scottish legislature in Edinburgh while leaving foreign affairs in the hands of the British parliament. A vote on devolution failed in 1979, but another succeeded overwhelmingly in 1997 and home rule was finally approved. Elections to the new Scottish Parliament were scheduled in 1999.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les premiers règlement en Ecosse Mai date dès 4000 avant JC Beaucoup de grandes structures restent de la dernière partie du Nouvel Âge de la pierre. Les Romains ont tenté de réprimer les tribus du nord militariste. Éventuellement, ils se retirent au sud du Mur d'Hadrien, qu'ils ont terminé en l'an 128 dans le nord de l'Angleterre. Les Pictes et les Scots, le long des Britanniques, des Angles, et les Vikings, ont tous contribué à la création d'un royaume écossais par les 10e et 11e siècles. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Les premières années du règne de l'Écosse est caractérisée par la violence. Shakespeare's "Macbeth" en est un exemple. Dans l'histoire, le roi écossais Duncan I est tué par ses généraux Macbeth et son fils, Malcolm III, succède sur le trône. Le 13ème siècle a été plus pacifique. Toutefois, en 1290, les seigneurs écossais a combattu sur la succession au trône. England's King Edward tenté mais n'a pas réussi à installer un roi sur le trône écossais. Il a ensuite envahi l'Ecosse et s'est déclaré maître. L'écossais est levée contre Edward I, sous la direction d'un grand héros, Sir William Wallace. Après l'exécution de Wallace, la révolte a continué sous la direction de Robert de Bruce, le premier candidat pour le trône. Il fut couronné roi Robert Ier en 1306. Il a battu les anglais à Bannockburn en 1314, et en 1328, le Français signe un traité reconnaissant l'indépendance de l'Ecosse. [PARAGRAPH 1] Robert II, le fils de David meurt sans enfant. Plusieurs nobles sont battus pour le trône, et à la famille noble Stuart gagné. Robert II, le premier roi Stuart, a été couronné en 1371. A côté Stuart roi Jacques Ier, et son fils Jacques II de renforcer le gouvernement central. Pendant ce temps, le commerce a prospéré et les universités ont été fondées. Ecosse était habituellement alliée avec la France contre l'Angleterre au cours de ces années. En 1502, James IV essayé de renforcer les liens de l'Écosse avec l'Angleterre en épousant Margaret Tudor. Margaret était la fille du roi Henri VII. Mais les conflits entre James et Henry VIII conduit à la guerre frontalière. James a été tué à la bataille de Flodden Field en 1513 et a été succédé par son fils, James V. [POINT: 1] Une des plus célèbres Ecosse gouvernants, Mary Queen of Scots, la fille de James V, a statué en ce moment. Elle a été le dernier monarque d'un royaume distinct écossais. En 1603, son fils Jacques VI a succédé sur le trône d'Angleterre et l'Irlande comme James I. Avec l'Acte d'Union en 1707, l'Angleterre, l'Irlande et l'Ecosse ont été réunis sous un parlement et une règle. Pays de Galles était déjà sous domination anglaise pour le moment. Pendant ce temps, les écossais ont continué à maintenir leur propre identité. [PARAGRAPH 1] Depuis l'écossais cessé de se gouverner eux-mêmes, des générations de nationalistes écossais ont appelé à un État indépendant. Plus modéré, les gens ont appuyé la déconcentration, ce qui reviendrait à pouvoir sur les affaires locales à un législateur élu écossais à Édimbourg, tout en laissant les affaires étrangères entre les mains du parlement britannique. Un vote sur la décentralisation a échoué en 1979, mais un autre a réussi une écrasante majorité en 1997 et la maison règle a été finalement approuvée. Élections du nouveau Parlement écossais étaient prévues en 1999.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die ältesten Siedlung in Schottland Mai stammen aus so früh wie 4000 v. Chr. Viele große Strukturen bleiben aus der später ein Teil der New Stone Age. Die Römer versuchten zu unterdrücken, die militaristische nördlichen Stämme. Schließlich zog sie südlich von Hadrian's Wall, die sie im Jahr 128 in Nordengland. Die Pikten und Schotten, entlang der Briten, Winkel, und die Wikinger, die alle einen Beitrag zur Schaffung eines schottischen Reich durch die 10. und 11. Jahrhundert. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Die frühen Jahre der schottischen Reiches ist geprägt von Gewalt. Shakespeares "Macbeth" ist ein Beispiel. In der Geschichte, den schottischen König Duncan I getötet von seinem allgemeinen Macbeth und sein Sohn, Malcolm III, die Nachfolge auf den Thron. Das 13. Jahrhundert war eher ruhig. Doch in 1290, Scottish Fürsten kämpfte über die Thronfolge. England's King Edward versucht, die Installation eines Königs in den schottischen Thron. Er erobert Schottland und erklärte sich Oberherr. Die Schotten stieg gegen Edward I unter der Führung eines großen Helden, Sir William Wallace. Nach der Hinrichtung Wallace, der Aufstand unter der Führung von Robert the Bruce, der führende Kandidat für den Thron. Er wurde zum König gekrönt Robert I und 1306. Er besiegte die Engländer bei Bannockburn in 1314 und in 1328, der englische unterzeichnete einen Vertrag zu erkennen, die Unabhängigkeit Schottlands. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Robert's Sohn David II. starb kinderlos. Mehrere Adlige kämpften für den Thron, und der adeligen Familie Stuart gewonnen. Robert II., der erste König Stuart, der 1371 gekrönt wurde. Ein später Stuart König James I., und sein Sohn James II der Zentralregierung gestärkt. Während dieser Zeit, der Handel blühte und Universitäten wurden gegründet. Schottland in der Regel zusammen mit Frankreich gegen England in diesen Jahren. In 1502, James IV versucht, die Beziehungen zu stärken Schottland England durch Heirat mit Margaret Tudor. Margaret war die Tochter von König Heinrich VII.. Aber Konflikte zwischen James und Henry VIII führte zur Grenze Krieg. James umgebracht wurde in der Schlacht von Flodden Field in 1513 gelungen, und wurde von seinem Sohn, James V. [PARAGRAPH: 1] One of Scotland's bekannteste Herrscher, Mary, Queen of Scots, James V's Tochter, entschieden, zu diesem Zeitpunkt. Sie war die letzte Monarch einer eigenen schottischen Reich. In 1603 ihren Sohn James VI erfolgreich auf den Thron von England und Irland als James I. Mit dem Act of Union in 1707, England, Irland und Schottland waren vereint unter einem Parlament und Lineal. Wales war bereits in der Regel Englisch zu dieser Zeit. Unterdessen setzte die Schotten um ihre eigene Identität. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Schon seit den Schotten nicht mehr sich selbst zu regieren, Generationen von schottischen Nationalisten forderten einen unabhängigen Staat. Mehr moderaten Menschen unterstützt haben, Dezentralisierung, die Rückkehr zur Macht über lokale Angelegenheiten zu einer Legislaturperiode gewählt schottischen Edinburgh, während er in der Außenpolitik in den Händen der britischen Parlament. Eine Abstimmung über die Dezentralisierung im Jahr 1979 gescheitert, sondern einem anderen gelang 1997 mit überwältigender Mehrheit in der Regel zu Hause und wurde schließlich genehmigt. Die Wahlen zum neuen schottischen Parlament wurden im Jahr 1999 geplant.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I primi insediamenti in Scozia maggio data fin dal 4000 aC Molte grandi strutture di rimanere il più tardi da parte di New Stone Age. Romani ha tentato di sopprimere la militarista tribù del nord. Infine, si ritirò a sud del Vallo di Adriano, che hanno completato l'anno 128 in tutta l'Inghilterra settentrionale. Pitti e scozzese, lungo i britannici, Angles, e la Vichinghi, tutti hanno contribuito alla creazione di un regno scozzese dal 10 ° e 11 ° secolo. [PARAGRAPH: 1] I primi anni del regno di Scozia è caratterizzata dalla violenza. Shakespeare's "Macbeth" è un esempio. E la storia, il re scozzese Duncan I viene ucciso dai suoi generali di Macbeth e di suo figlio, Malcolm III, succede al trono. Il 13 ° secolo è stata più tranquilla. Tuttavia, nel 1290, oltre scozzese signori combattuto la successione al trono. England's King Edward cercato, ma non è riuscita a installare un re in trono scozzese. Egli ha poi invaso la Scozia e si è dichiarato overlord. La rosa scozzese contro Edoardo I, sotto la guida di un grande eroe, Sir William Wallace. Dopo Wallace's esecuzione, la rivolta continuato sotto la guida di Robert il Bruce, il principale candidato per il trono. Egli fu incoronato re Roberto I nel 1306. Egli ha sconfitto gli inglesi a Bannockburn nel 1314, e nel 1328, l'inglese ha firmato un trattato di riconoscere l'indipendenza della Scozia. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Robert figlio di David II morì senza figli. Diversi nobili lottato per il trono, e la nobile famiglia Stuart ha vinto. Robert II, il primo re Stuart, fu incoronato nel 1371. A più tardi Stuart re Giacomo I, e suo figlio Giacomo II rafforzato il governo centrale. Durante questo tempo, il commercio fiorì e università sono state fondate. Scozia era solito alleò con la Francia contro l'Inghilterra nel corso di questi anni. Nel 1502, James IV cercato di rafforzare i legami con la Scozia, Inghilterra sposando Margherita Tudor. Margaret era la figlia del re Enrico VII. Ma i conflitti tra Enrico VIII e James ha portato a guerra di confine. James è stato ucciso nella battaglia di Flodden Field nel 1513 ed è stato succeduto da suo figlio, James V. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Uno dei più famosi Scozia governanti, Maria, Regina di Scozia, la figlia di James V, stabilito in questo momento. Fu l'ultimo monarca di un regno separato scozzese. Nel 1603 suo figlio Giacomo VI, succeduto al trono d'Inghilterra e in Irlanda, come James I. Con l'Atto di Unione nel 1707, in Inghilterra, Irlanda, Scozia, e sono stati uniti sotto un unico parlamento e righello. Galles era già in inglese regola in questo momento. Nel frattempo, gli scozzesi hanno continuato a mantenere la propria identità. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Fin dalla scozzese cessato di governare se stessi, generazioni di nazionalisti scozzesi hanno chiesto uno stato indipendente. Più moderato persone hanno sostenuto devoluzione, che oltre a riprendere il potere locale affari di uno scozzese eletto legislatore a Edimburgo, lasciando la politica estera nelle mani del parlamento britannico. Un voto sulla devolution venuta meno nel 1979, ma un altro riuscito ampiamente nel 1997 e home regola è stata finalmente approvata. Elezioni per il nuovo Parlamento scozzese sono stati programmati nel 1999.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los primeros asentamientos en Escocia fecha a partir de Mayo ya en 4000 aC Muchas grandes estructuras de la parte posterior de la Nueva Edad de Piedra. Los romanos trataron de reprimir la militarista norte de las tribus. Finalmente, se retiraron al sur de la Muralla de Adriano, que se completó en el año 128 a través del norte de Inglaterra. Imágenes y el escocés, a lo largo de los británicos, Angles, y de los vikingos, todos contribuyeron a la creación de un reino de Escocia por la 10 ª y 11 siglos. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Los primeros años del reino de Escocia se caracteriza por la violencia. Shakespeare "Macbeth" es un ejemplo. En la historia, el rey Duncan I de Escocia es asesinado por sus generales Macbeth y su hijo, Malcolm III, sucede en el trono. El siglo 13 fue más pacífico. Sin embargo, en 1290, el escocés luchó más de los señores de la sucesión al trono. England's King Edward intentado, pero no para instalar un rey en el trono de Escocia. A continuación, invadió Escocia, y se declaró jefe supremo. El escocés levanta contra Edward I, bajo la dirección de un gran héroe, Sir William Wallace. Después de la ejecución de Wallace, la rebelión continuó bajo la dirección de Robert de Bruce, el principal candidato para el trono. Fue coronado Rey Robert I en 1306. Él derrotó al Inglés en Bannockburn en 1314, y en 1328, el Inglés firmaron un tratado reconociendo la independencia de Escocia. [PARAGRAPH: 1] el hijo de David Robert II murió sin hijos. Varios nobles lucharon por el trono, y de la noble familia de Stuart ganó. Robert II, el primer rey Stuart, fue coronado en 1371. Un rey Stuart más tarde, Jaime I, y su hijo Jaime II el fortalecimiento de la administración central. Durante este tiempo, el comercio floreció y se fundaron las universidades. Escocia fue generalmente aliado con Francia contra Inglaterra en estos años. En 1502, James IV trató de fortalecer los vínculos de Escocia con Inglaterra por matrimonio con Margaret Tudor. Margarita era hija del rey Enrique VII. Sin embargo, los conflictos entre James y Enrique VIII llevó a la guerra fronteriza. James fue asesinado en la Batalla de Flodden Field en 1513 y fue sucedido por su hijo, James V. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Uno de Escocia más famosa de los gobernantes, María, Reina de escocés, la hija de James V, se pronunció en este momento. Fue el último monarca de un reino de Escocia. En 1603 su hijo James VI de la sucesión al trono de Inglaterra e Irlanda como James I. Con el Acta de Unión en 1707, Inglaterra, Irlanda y Escocia se unieron bajo un solo parlamento y gobernante. País de Gales ya está en Inglés imperio en este momento. Mientras tanto, el escocés siguió manteniendo su propia identidad. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Desde el escocés dejó de gobernarse a sí mismo, generaciones de los nacionalistas escoceses han pedido un estado independiente. Más moderado personas han apoyado la descentralización, que volvería a poder sobre los asuntos locales a un legislador electo de Escocia en Edimburgo, dejando los asuntos exteriores en manos del parlamento británico. Una votación de la devolución no en 1979, sino otro logrado por abrumadora mayoría en 1997 y la regla de origen fue finalmente aprobado. Las elecciones para el nuevo Parlamento escocés se había previsto en 1999.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"What sort of men are these!?" That question must have perplexed the Persian leader Darius when, in the midst of battle, he watched his Scythian enemies abandon the serious business of war in order to take off suddenly in chase of a hare they had spied. Well the same query persists in the minds of modern civilized men as scholarship adds to what we know about this strange custom of Eurasia's mounted nomad. New research and thousands of examined burial sites in the last Panticipaeum years in South Russia and the Altai have helped us to paint a much fuller picture of this vigorous nomad people with their unique animal art and love of the horse - an extraordinary race from whom the civilized world learned to wear trousers and riding horses.[PARAGRAPH:2]Perhaps the most striking feature of Scythians was the enormous amount of gold they wore and used. The ancient legend tells the story about the one-eyed people, Arimaspians in Scythia who had on-going battle with the griffins who guarded the gold. This gold undoubtedly came from the rich fields in the Altai district. It is common that the Scythians wore golden ornaments and belts. Gold plates were sewn to their garments and gold gleamed from their weapons. The archaeologists are consistently amazed by the amount of gold offerings deposited in the great burial- mounds of the Scythian kings.[PARAGRAPH:2]Where had they come from? The Scythians themselves had a legend that they sprang from the three sons of certain Targitaus, a person of supernatural birth who dwelled in the Black Sea domain. Together the three brothers ruled the land until four golden implements - a plow, a yoke, a battle-ax and a drinking cup - fell from the sky and suddenly began to blaze. Colaxais, the youngest, proved to be the only one of the brothers who could pick up the burning objects, and thus became sole ruler of the Scythian kingdom.[PARAGRAPH:2]Another Scythian creation story was told by the ancient Diodorus Siculus at the 1st century BC According to Diodorus, Scythians "lived in very small numbers at the Araks River....that they gained for themselves a country in the mountains up to the Caucasus, in the lowland on the coast of the Ocean (Caspian Sea) and the Meot Lake (Azov Sea) and other territories up to the Tanais River (Don River). Born in that land from the conjugal union of Zeus and a snake-legged goddess was a son Scyth who gave the name Scythian to the people." His descendants were named Pal and Naps and were the ancestors of two congenetic people - pals and naps. "They won for themselves a country "behind the Tanais River up to the Egyptian Nile River".[PARAGRAPH:2]Dating the earliest Scythians has been a problem since they did not develop their distinctive art style until the 6th century BC A. I. Melyukova suggested that the early Scythians were descendants of tribes of the Srubnaya culture who, between the middle of the 2nd millenium BC and the end of the 7th century BC, moved in several waves from the Volga-Ural steppes into the north Black Sea area and assimilated the local Cimmerians. In history, the Scythians was first recorded in the 7th century BC as Assyria's ally against the Cimmerians, who had lost their homeland to the Scythians and moved south. The Scythian king, Partatua married an Assyrian princess in 674 BC and two nations remained allies. Scythians and Assyrians together conquered the Medes of the Caspian Sea; however the Medes was able to drive the Scythians out of western Asia and back to the Pontic Steppes by the turn of the century.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first mounted nomads to attract the attention of historians were the Scythians. If the Scythians were not the first to domesticate the horse they were among the earliest, if not the first of the Central Asian people to learn to ride it. Mounted soldiers was the Scythians' success in war; so when they penetrated into Asia, the technique of riding was rapidly adopted and mastered throughout the entire Middle Eastern area.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Scythians were famous for their bloody tribal custom. Warriors not only cut off the heads of slain enemies but also made leather-bound drinking cups from their enemies' skulls. They lined these grisly trophies with gold and proudly displayed them to impress their guests. Prolonged and demonstrative grieving followed the death of every Scythian tribesman. At the death of a king all Scythian tribes joined a show of stupendous grief that last Solokha days. Men of the dominant tribe, the Royal Scythians, cropped their hair, lacerated their ears, forehead, noses and arms. After the king was buried with the best of all his weapons and possessions, the funeral party strangled one of his concubines, his cupbearer, his cook, his lackey, his messenger and his best horses and place all the bodies by him. Then the grave was to be covered with 60-feet hight mound.[PARAGRAPH:2]Even then, the funeral was not over. One year later as many as Tanais Scythian youths might be selected from among those who had directly served the king. They would be strangled and buried in a circle around the royal tomb.[PARAGRAPH:2]One thing that Herodotus failed to report about these Scythian warriors is that they produced art of stunning force and vitality. Around the 6th century BC, the Scythian created an art of pattern and ornament with naturalistic motifs based on animals. The favorite animals of the Scythian style are the stag, the horse, the ibex, the boar, the bear, the wolf, the felines, the eagle and the fish. The Scythian animal art style was adopted by all the mounted nomads as far as the borders of China by the end of the first millennium BC. During last two centuries, many rich and extraordinary finds were excavated from Scythian tombs and graves such as Pazyryk site in the Altai mountain of south-central Siberia, Kul Oba in the Kuban basin of the northern Black Sea.

[TAB]After the death of Alexander the Great in the afternoon of 11 June 323 BCE, his empire was divided by his generals, the Diadochi. One of them was his friend Seleucus, who became king of the eastern provinces - more or less modern Afghanistan, Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Lebanon, together with parts of Turkey, Armenia, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, and Tajikistan. His kingdom had two capitals, which he founded in c.300: Antioch in Syria (pictures) and Seleucia in Mesopotamia. Babylon was another important city. The empire was, like the empire of Alexander, actually the continuation of the empires before: the Assyrian, Babylonian, and the Achaemenid Empire.[PARAGRAPH:2]Seleucus' reign lasted from 312 to 281 (more...), and he was succeeded by his descendants, who continued to govern this assembly of countries for more than two centuries. However, in the mid-240's, during a brief interregnum, the Seleucids started to lose territory in the east, where the Parni nomads settled themselves in the satrapy of Parthia in northeastern Iran. At the same time, the satrapy of Bactria (northern Afghanistan) became independent. Later, the Seleucid king Antiochus III the Great was able to reconquer these territories, during a series of eastern wars between 209 and 204. In the southwest, the Seleucid kings fought several "Syrian wars" with the Egyptians; in 200, their king was forced to cede Palestine to Antiochus III. Seleucid power had reached its zenith. Yet, Antiochus was also forced to witness the beginning of its demise.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 196, he crossed the Hellespont in order to add Thrace to his empire (which happened in 194). Seleucid influence in Europe, however, was something that the Romans could not allow to happen, and the inevitable war between the two superpowers broke out in 192. (One of our sources, the Syriaca by the Greek historian Appian of Alexandria, can be read here.) Antiochus received support from many Greek towns and help from the famous Carthaginian general Hannibal, but was defeated and forced to pay a tremendous sum of money. Moreover, the Seleucid empire lost its possessions in what is now Turkey.[PARAGRAPH:2]The tide was now turning against the Seleucid monarchy. In the west, Rome became too powerful to resist. Worse, they backed the Jews, who liberated themselves in the years after 165 (the Maccabaean revolt). At the same time, the Parni founded the Parthian empire, which snatched away the eastern provinces. The towns in Babylonia, a.o. Seleucia and Babylon, were captured between April and June 141. New losses followed, civil wars between two rival factions of the Seleucid family were inevitable, and in the second quarter of the first century, the Roman generals Lucullus and Pompey the Great made an end to the Seleucid kingdom. The last king was dethroned in 64.[PARAGRAPH:2]The official name of the kingdom was Asia, but the Romans called it Syria.

[TAB]The Seljuk Turks (also Seldjuk, Seluk, Seljuk Turks) ruled a huge Persianized empire in the eleventh century, which was a practical successor to the northern part of the Arab empire, as it included Baghdad and all of Persia. At its largest extent, which lasted for only a brief time, it also included all of Palestine and Anatolia in the West, and a large part of Afghanistan in the East, and reached as far north as the Aral sea and Armenia. The Seljuks were originally a clan or clans of the Oguz or Oghuz Turkmen tribes that invaded the Central Asian Steppes about 1000 CE. They converted to Islam, and, on conquering Persia, became Persianized in language and culture. The rapid Seljuk expansion alarmed Christian Europe, which became concerned for the fate of the Eastern Roman Empire ("Byzantium" with its capital at Constantinople). It also attracted the attentions of all the rival Muslim emirates and dynasties on their borders, and particularly the Shi'a, whose faithful were a majority in the area of Iran.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Seljuks came to speak Persian and spread Persian culture throughout the Middle East. and they used Farsi as their official language. As with many of the Muslim empires, divisions were fostered by unclear rules of succession and by splitting up the emirates among the sons of rulers. Nominally, all the associated realms were ruled by a Grand Sultan, but the connections were weak and the they were slow to aid each other in case of attack. The Seljuk empire contracted until it was left only with Eastern Anatolia, called the "The Seljuks of Rum." Rum is the Arab word for "Rome," meaning the Byzantine empire. This area was populated by Byzantine Christians, Armenians and Sunni and Shia Muslims. The Seljuks succeeded in providing a relatively stable and tolerant state. The Seljuk empire was subjugated by the Mongols and eventually eliminated.[PARAGRAPH:2]About 1040 Togrul Beg, chief of the Seljuks and grandson of Seljuk, began to conquer large parts of the lands that comprises modern Iran and Iraq. By 1055, he had conquered Baghdad from the Shia Buyids, and made himself protector of the caliph in Baghdad. Nominally, the Caliph was his superior, and bestowed the title of Sultan on him. Togrul's successor, Alp Arslan, expanded significantly upon Togrul's holdings by adding Armenia and Georgia in 1064 and invading the Byzantine Empire in 1068, from which he annexed almost all of Anatolia; Arslan's decisive victory at the Battle of Manzikert (in 1071) effectively neutralized the Byzantine threat, and, according to some historians, the Byzantines' defeat began their long decline. Alp Arslan authorized his Turcoman generals to carve their own principalities out of formerly Byzantine Anatolia, as atabegs loyal to him. Within two years the Turcomans had established control as far as the Aegean Sea under numerous "beghliks" (modern Turkish beyliks): the Saltuklus in Northeastern Anatolia, Mengujeqs in Eastern Anatolia, Artuqids in Southeastern Anatolia, Danishmendis in Central Anatolia, Rum Seljuks (Beghlik of Suleyman, which later moved to Central Anatolia) in Western Anatolia and the Beghlik of Caka Beg in Izmir (Smyrna).[PARAGRAPH:2]A crucial stage in Seljuk history and in the history of Muslim-Christian relations was marked by the Battle of Manzikert in 1071. The Battle of Manzikert was fought between the Byzantine Empire lead by Emperor Romanos IV Diogenes and Seljuk forces led by Alp Arslan on August 26, 1071 near Manzikert (Malazgirt). The power of the Byzantine empire had been waning. This battle demonstrated its weakness. The Emperor was captured and humiliated, but set free. The following year, Arslan died and the Turks proceeded to settle Anatolia, capturing Iconium (Konya) and making it the seat of their Rum sultanate. News of the Battle of Manzikert ignited the first Crusade. [PARAGRAPH:2]Toward the end of the Eleventh century and the beginning of the twelfth, the Seljuk state in Persia began disintegrating into smaller states, ruled by relatives and descendants of the previous sultans. Western Persia (Hamadan) came to be ruled by a different line than southern Persia, Kerman, though for a time the Sultanate of Rum remained nominally under their sway. In 1097, the Seljuks were defeated by the Crusaders in Anatolia, losing Western Anatolia to Christian rulers. In 1194, Togrul III, the last Iranian Seljuk sultan, fell on the battlefield fighting Khwarazmshah, who annexed Western Persia. [PARAGRAPH:2]Around 1230 the Seljuks of Rum fought the Khorezmians and defeated them. However, they were invaded and subjugated by the Mongols in 1243. Seljuk rulers continued to rule as tributaries of the Mongols. Ghiyath ad-Din Mesud II, the last Seljuk Sultan, was removed and reinstated in office several times by his Mongol overlords. He died or was removed from office for the last time about 1306 or 1307, ending the Seljuk line.[PARAGRAPH:2][PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [TAB]The ancestors of the Serbs settled in the region during the 600s AD. During these early years of settlement, the Serbs came under a strong influence of the Byzantine Empire. In the late 1100s, Stephen Nemanja founded the first sovereign, unified Serbian state. Serbia arrived at its zenith in the 1300s, under King Stefan Dusan. But in 1389 the Ottoman Turks defeated a coalition led by Serbia at the historic Battle of Kosovo, starting the period of Ottoman rule that was to remain for the next 500 years. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Rebellions against the Ottomans began in 1804 and lasted until Serbia won its independence in 1878. The country began to gather all Serbian lands and peoples into a unified state. Thus, Austria's takeover, in 1908, of Bosnia and Herzegovina, with its high density of Serbs, incited a time of bitter antagonism in Serbia. [PARAGRAPH: 1] When the war ended in 1918, Serbia led the movement to form the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes under the Serbian royal dynasty. The country was renamed Kingdom of Yugoslavia in 1929. Serbian efforts to control the area aroused the hostility of other nationalities, especially the Croats. After Yugoslavia was inhabited by Nazi Germany in 1941, during World War II, it became a battlefield between the two challenging guerrilla groups, the Serbian Chetniks and the Communist-led Partisans. At the conclusion of the war in 1945, Serbia became one of the republics of the new Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, organized by the Communist leader Josip Broz Tito. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Tito's firm authority over the country kept the old ethnic competitions and hatreds in check, but after his death in 1980, the intricate government organization began to crumble. Serbian leaders were determined to convert the federation into a national state under Serbian control. Other republics preferred a looser confederation. Serbia responded to their secession with the use of federal military forces. The resulting civil war cost thousands of lives and great destruction of property in Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. In 1992, Serbia proclaimed itself and Montenegro to be the successor to the Yugoslav state, as the Federated Republic of Yugoslavia. After Montenegro left the federation in 2006, Serbia formed the Republic of Serbia as the official successor of the union of Serbia and Montenegro.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les ancêtres des Serbes ont arrangé dans la région pendant le 600s APRÈS JÉSUS CHRIST. Pendant ces premières années de règlement, les Serbes ont relevé d'une influence forte de l'empire bizantin. Vers la fin de 1100s, Stephen Nemanja a fondé le premier état serbe souverain et unifié. La Serbie est arrivée à son zénith dans le 1300s, sous le Roi Stefan Dusan. Mais dans 1389 les Turcs de tabouret ont défait une coalition menée par la Serbie à la bataille historique de Kosovo, commençant la période de la règle de tabouret qui était de rester pendant les 500 années à venir. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] Les rébellions contre les tabourets ont commencé en 1804 et ont duré jusqu'à ce que la Serbie ait gagné son indépendance en 1878. Le pays a commencé à recueillir tous les terres et peuples serbes dans un état unifié. Ainsi, le changement de l'Autriche, dans 1908, de la Bosnie et de la Herzégovine, avec sa densité des Serbes, a incité un moment de l'antagonisme amer en Serbie. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] Quand la guerre a fini en 1918, la Serbie a mené le mouvement à former le royaume des Serbes, des Croates, et des Slovènes sous la dynastie royale serbe. Le pays a été retitré royaume de la Yougoslavie en 1929. Les efforts serbes de commander le secteur ont réveillé l'hostilité d'autres nationalités, particulièrement les Croates. Après que la Yougoslavie ait été habitée par Nazi Allemagne en 1941, pendant la deuxième guerre mondiale, lui est devenu un champ de bataille entre les deux groupes provocants de guérillero, le Chetniks serbe et les partisans Communiste-menés. À la conclusion de la guerre en 1945, la Serbie est devenue l'une des républiques de la nouvelle République fédérale socialiste de la Yougoslavie, organisée par le Chef communiste Josip Broz Tito. [PARAGRAPHE : 1] L'autorité ferme de Tito au-dessus du pays a maintenu les vieux concours et hatreds ethniques dans le contrôle, mais après sa mort en 1980, l'organisation complexe de gouvernement a commencé à s'émietter. Des chefs serbes ont été déterminés pour convertir la fédération en état national sous la commande serbe. D'autres républiques ont préféré une confédération plus lâche. La Serbie a répondu à leur secession avec l'utilisation des forces militaires fédérales. La guerre civile résultante a coûté beaucoup de milliers des vies et grande destruction de propriété en Croatie et la Bosnie et Herzégovine. En 1992, la Serbie s'est proclamée et Montenegro pour être le successeur à l'état yougoslave, comme République fédérée de la Yougoslavie. Après que Montenegro ait laissé la fédération en 2006, la Serbie a formé la République de la Serbie comme successeur officiel de l'union de la Serbie et du Montenegro.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Vorfahren der Serben vereinbarten in der Region während des 600s V. CHR. Während dieser frühen Jahre der Regelung, kamen die Serben unter einen starken Einfluß des byzantinischen Reiches. Ende 1100s gründete Stephen Nemanja den ersten souveränen, vereinheitlichten serbischen Zustand. Serbien kam zu seinem Zenit im 1300s, unter König Stefan Dusan. Aber in 1389 besiegten die Ottoman-Türken eine Koalition, die durch Serbien an der historischen Schlacht von Kosovo geführt wurde und begannen die Periode der Ottomanrichtlinie, die, für die folgenden 500 Jahre zu bleiben war. [PUNKT: 1] Aufstände gegen die Ottomans fingen 1804 an und dauerten, bis Serbien seine Unabhängigkeit 1878 gewann. Das Land fing an, alle serbischen Länder und Völker in einen vereinheitlichten Zustand zu erfassen. So reizte übernahme Österreichs, 1908, von Bosnien und von Herzegovina, mit seinem High-density von Serben, eine Zeit des bitteren Antagonismus in Serbien an. [PUNKT: 1] Als der Krieg 1918 beendete, führte Serbien die Bewegung, das Königreich von Serben, von Kroaten und von Slovenes unter der serbischen königlichen Dynastie zu bilden. Das Land wurde Königreich von Jugoslawien 1929 umbenannt. Serbische Bemühungen, den Bereich zu steuern weckten die Feindseligkeit anderer Nationalitäten, besonders die Kroaten. Nachdem Jugoslawien von Nazi Deutschland 1941, während des Zweiten Weltkrieges bewohnt wurde, es wurde ein Schlachtfeld zwischen den zwei schwierigen Bandenkämpfergruppen, dem serbischen Chetniks und den Kommunistisch-führenden Parteigängern. An der Zusammenfassung des Krieges 1945, wurde Serbien eine der Republiken der neuen sozialistischen Bundesrepublik von Jugoslawien, organisiert vom kommunistischen Führer Josip Broz Tito. [PUNKT: 1] Titos feste Berechtigung über dem Land hielt die alten ethnischen Konkurrenzen und die hatreds in der überprüfung, aber nach seinem Tod 1980, fing die schwierige Regierung Organisation an zu zerbröckeln. Serbische Führer wurden festgestellt, um die Vereinigung in einen nationalen Zustand unter serbischer Steuerung umzuwandeln. Andere Republiken bevorzugten ein loseres Bündnis. Serbien reagierte auf ihre Sezession mit dem Gebrauch von militärischen föderativkräften. Der resultierende Bürgerkrieg kostete viele Tausenden Leben und große Zerstörung der Eigenschaft im Kroatien und Bosnien und Herzegovina. 1992 proklamierte sich Serbien und Montenegro, um der Nachfolger zum jugoslawischen Zustand zu sein, als die zu einem Bündnis vereingigte Republik von Jugoslawien. Nachdem Montenegro die Vereinigung 2006 ließ, bildete Serbien die Republik von Serbien als der amtliche Nachfolger des Anschlußes von Serbien und von Montenegro.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli antenati dei serbi si sono depositati nella regione durante l'ANNUNCIO 600s.
